loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fixed assets like chairs, tables, a stove, etc. to continue meeting customer demand in the area.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es: Daniel es un hombre trabajador de 38 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de herramientas y repuestos  para aparatos de audio y video, lo cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia desde hace 17 años. Daniel logro construir su vivienda con la ayuda de su esposa, y es con ella y sus dos hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad que vive actualmente. Daniel desea invertir en su negocio, ya que carece de algunas herramientas y desea tener mayor cantidad de repuestos para ofrecer a su clientela, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: herramientas, parlantes, cables electrónicos, audífonos, micrófonos entre otros.
texts.en:
Daniel is 38 year old hard-working man. He works selling tools and parts for audio and video equipment which has allowed him to progress with his family for 17 years. Daniel has managed to construct his house with the help of his wife and it is her and their two children aged 16 and 6 years old that he lives with at present.

Daniel wants to invest in his business as he is lacking some tools and wants to have a greater quantity of parts to offer his clients. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in tools, speakers, electronic cables, earphones and microphones amongst others.

loans.use: to invest in tools, speakers, electronic cables, earphones and microphones amongst others.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose considered Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and all of the lenders participating in the Kiva program as God’s medium of blessing to her. She’s delighted of having CCT since the prior loan of P18, 000 was granted. And the amount has been a supplementary capital for her business’ growth. She was able to buy grocery items for the retail general store to become more attractive to customers.

Delayed payments is what challenges her. Proper marketing strategy and well treatment to customers are the qualities that she has. For 18 years she has the business and it’s still growing. Rose is able to support her children’s educational expenses because of her diligence and determination. Since to finish their studies is one of her dreams. 

However, she’s not satisfied about the recent status of the business since as an entrepreneur you should always think of ways on how to step-up. She applied for a loan of P15, 000 as she wants her business to be a one-stop-shop someday. She’s hoping that her request will be granted as an added capital for the business.

Rose is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to add to her business

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has one child who is in school.

Agustina has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Agustina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Regleta

texts.en:
Regleta is a married woman who works hard to support her family by raising pigs over the past 5 years.

Regleta requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Regleta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rosary

texts.en:
Rosary is a 32-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosary has had a motorcycle transportation business for 1 year and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

In the future, Rosary would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 60-year-old married woman with six children.

Leonora has raised pigs for 9 years and requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 10 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Leonora would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marbelita

texts.en:
Marbelita works hard to support her family. Marbelita is married and has a buy and sell ginger business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell.

Marbelita has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Marbelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 31 years old and is married with three children. With all three children in school, Sherly works very hard to provide for her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sherly has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, noodles, and personal care products.

In the future, Sherly would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from clothing retail.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a 55-year-old married woman with eight children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Zosima has sold tobacco for 8 years and requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more tobacco to sell to her customers.

She hopes to save money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 50-year-old married woman with three children,one attends school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel has run a general store for 15 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy candies, biscuits, bread, coffee, detergent, shampoo, and noodles.

Maribel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits, bread, coffee, detergent, shampoo, and noodles.

loans.name: Maria Elma

texts.en:
Maria Elma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Elma is 58 years old and has one child still in school.

Maria Elma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maria Elma requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business. Maria Elma has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Zelia

texts.en: Zelia is a business woman with a small kiosk, and she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, gambling cards, coffee, water, sugar, hand and body supplies, and soft drinks. She also sells gasoline. Zelia opened her kiosk in 2002 with her own working capital of $200. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, gambling cards, coffee, water, sugar, hand and body supplies, soft drinks and gasoline.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 50 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking female entrepreneur.

Leonila has a business where she buys and sells rice grains in the Philippines. Leonila requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grain to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 62-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lucia has a business where she buys and sells personal care items in the Philippines. Lucia requested a 27,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more personal care products, like perfume, body lotion, deodorant, bags, underwear, shampoo, etc.

Lucia has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products, like perfume, body lotion, deodorant, bags, underwear, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Rajmonda

texts.en:
Rajmonda and her husband, Simon are in their twenties and parents of a 6-year-old. For about a year now, she has been collecting organic fertilizer from tree leaves and selling it. She's been digging large holes in the forests, where she throws leaves from trees around and then covers these holes with plastic. After some time, when the leaves are fully decomposed, she gets the remains out and sells it to other villagers, who claim that it has been very good for their plants.

It's to Rajmonda's advantage that she lives almost in the forest with fruitless trees. This land is owned by her family and is not fertile, meaning she cannot plant anything, but she can do what she's doing to use it to the fullest. So far, she has paid others to rent their mules and horses to do the transportation. She now wants to invest in a transportation vehicle to do the transporting of the decomposing organic fertilizer to flower stores and villagers upon their request.

The activity is the only source of earning for the family in addition to some retirement pension of $65/month for her mother-in-law.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to transport the decomposing organic fertilizer that she makes herself to flower shops and other villagers upon request.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina works hard to support her family via a vinegar business for the past 16 years.

She requests 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of vinegar to sell.

In the future, Charina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is a 34-year-old married woman with three children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Adelfa has had a fruit vending business for 8 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruit to sell.

In the future, Adelfa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business. Nida has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from farming rice and buying and selling charcoal.

Nida successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 46-year-old married with six children, four attend school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 7 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, and soft drinks.

In the future Edna would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Chengkei

texts.en:
Chengkei, 27 years old, has one school-age child and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Chengkei has had a food vending business for 1 year and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Chengkei would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe is a 33-year-old married woman with five children, four attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anafe has sold seedlings for 4 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

In the future, Anafe would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Ma. Tessie

texts.en:
Ma. Tessie is 54 years old and married.

Ma. Tessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other personal care items.

Ma. Tessie has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other personal collection items.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by selling fruits and vegetables. Yolanda is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell at her general store.

Yolanda has sustained her business activities with two prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 38-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is the guardian of family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Asia has been running her own beauty salon for the past 12 years, she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hairbrushes, and other accessories or white wash for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business purposes.

Therefore Asia has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes, so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn a maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. For this financial assistance, Asia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Lorena Esteffanny

texts.es: Lorena de 31 años es una comerciante que a temprana edad se incorporó en los negocios de su familia; a sus 16 años apoyaba en las ventas de accesorios y productos para el cuidado corporal, labor que aprendió de su madre una vendedora empírica que ha ofrecido bienestar a su familia con esta actividad.  Hoy en día, Lorena está comprometida con su cónyuge y es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad, y desempeña sus roles sin ningún inconveniente puesto que su trabajo le brinda la libertad de disponer de su tiempo.  Ella desea mejorar sus inventarios y realizó una solicitud de crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su primer credikiva que invertirá en nuevo surtido de perfumes, shampoo y accesorios, de este modo su oferta de productos será mucho más tentadora y sus ventas se dinamizarán.  Su meta familiar es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorena, 31, is a merchant who joined the family business at a very young age; when she was 16 she helped out selling accessories and personal care products. She learned the work from her mother who was a self-taught merchant who earned an income for the family this way.

Nowadays Lorena is committed to her husband and she is the mother of four minor children. She carries out her roles without any inconvenience since her work allows her to manage her own time.

She wants to improve her inventory and has requested a loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, her first CrediKiva loan, to buy a variety of perfumes, shampoo and accessories. This way she can offer a more appealing range of products to tempt her customers and boost sales.

Her family goal is to improve her family's quality of life and to continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy a new batch of perfumes, shampoo and accessories.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Don Carlos de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 25 años y vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos para el maiz y frijol como: abono, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: 59-year-old Carlos lives with his son in his own home. He has been growing basic grains for 25 years, selling his products in nearby towns. He already has regular customers and he uses his income to cover some of his household expenses. He is applying for a loan to buy supplies for corn and beans, for example: manure, pesticide, weed killer, etc. This will enable him to boost his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for corn and beans, for example: manure, pesticide, weed killer, etc.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “LAS MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS” conformada por 05 socias emprendedoras. Este es el caso de MERY de 46 años de edad conviviente con dos hijos. Ella se dedica al servicio de costura Desde hace más de 20 años que tiene dicho negocio gracias a su esfuerzo logro mejorar su calidad de vida. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de hilos cierres y  botones .El grupo “las mujeres emprendedoras” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite mejorar su calidad de vida. Mery  es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste polo color negro.
texts.en: This is the new group “LAS MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS” which is made up of five enterprising women. And this is Mery's situation. She is 46 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has two children. She works sewing. She has had her business for more than 20 years thanks to her efforts to improve her quality of living. Her main desire is to be able to expand her business. She is requesting the loan to buy thread, zippers and buttons. The “Las Mujeres Emprendedoras” is grateful to the lenders at Kiva who make this loan possible as it allows her to improve her quality of living. Mery is the second from the left wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy thread, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 54 years old and married, with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Eva has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Eva has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Edna

texts.en:
Ma. Edna is 39 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Ma. Edna is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ma. Edna has been in this business for 16 years now, and she has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Edna would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en: Ritchel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ritchel is 26 years old and has one child still in school. Ritchel has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Ritchel requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables like garlic, onions, tomatoes, etc. Ritchel has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables like garlic, onions, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice (grain) business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell.

Annabelle has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Greza

texts.en:
Greza is 27 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Greza has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Greza has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia con una visión de superación muy clara, tiene  53 años de edad, con una linda familia que vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Miguel por ser un agricultor con mucha experiencia ha logrado sacar provecho a sus créditos pues gracias a ello ahora ya cultiva mucho más y con su anterior crédito pudo realizar la inversión en su cultivo y sus ingresos han mejorado.  Miguel tiene nuevamente la necesidad de un crédito para la compra de insumos  para la fumigación de unas cuerdas de flores que ahora tiene, él se ha inclinado para el cultivo de flores pues son las que mayor demanda tiene.
Su esperanza de vida es incrementar su cultivo y terminar la construcción de su casa, para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is a family man with a very clear vision for self improvement. He is 53 years old and has a lovely family living in the community of Solola.

By being a very experienced farmer, Miguel has been able to take advantage of his loans because thanks to them he now grows a lot more. With his previous loan he was able to invest in his crop and improve his income.

Once again, Miguel is in need of a loan to buy supplies to fumigate one of the rows of flowers he has. This is the crop he has decided on since there is more demand for it.

His goal in life is to increase his plantation and finish building his house so his family can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to maintain his flowers.

loans.name: Maryn

texts.en:
Maryn is 30 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Maryn works very hard to provide for them.

Maryn has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Maryn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as spices, eggs, sardines, diapers, and other groceries.

In the future Maryn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Danny Janeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mar y Cielo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Danny, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3  hijos de 13, 7 y 2  años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el municipio del cantón.
Doña Danny con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y helados, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días tres horas diarias y en temporadas las ventas las realizan ambulantemente, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene varios años en esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa interior y  helados. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años  y le gusta porque el grupo es unido. Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en: The Mar y Cielo credit group meets fortnightly in the Jaramijo canton. The area is known for its beautiful beaches and most of the residents are very hardworking and dedicated to sea-related jobs. This is where Danny lives. This 35-year-old woman is married with 3 children aged13, 7 and 2. The elder two go to secondary and primary school respectively. Danny's husband works at the local town hall. Wanting to have her own income to support her family, she sells clothing of all types and ice-cream. She sells her goods from door to door and also from her home, where she has small premises. She works for three hours each day and, at certain times of year, she sells them in the street, leaving goods with her customers on credit and collecting payments fortnightly. She goes to buy her stock in Guayaquil every fortnight or once a month, as required. She has been running this business for a number of years. She will use the loan to buy trousers, shirts, underwear and ice-cream. She has been a member of the credit group for 3 years and she appreciates it because it is a united group. Her dream is to see her children finish their education.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, underwear and ice creams.

loans.name: Dora Estela

texts.es: Dora de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con grupo familiar, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 10 años en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Dora, 46, lives in her own house with her family.

She has run a beauty salon from her home for the past 10 years. She has many customers because of the quality of her work. With the income that she earns, she manages to cover her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as creams, shampoos, hairpins, and scissors, among other items. With this purchase, she will be able to make a better profit, which will help her achieve better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoos, hairpins, and scissors, among other items.

loans.name: Jose German

texts.es: Jose de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una venta de frutas y verduras desdevhace 12 años, el cual está ubicado en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia gracias a sus ventas es como el ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, Jose solicita nuevamente otro préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que le va muy bien con sus ventas y asi podra seguir teniendo mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jose is 49 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has had a business for 12 years selling fruit and vegetables from a market located near his house. Thanks to the sales from this business he has been able to pay his household expenses. Jose is requesting another loan to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale, because his sales are going well and this way he can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is a married woman, 46 years old. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Venus has a fishing business in the Philippines. Venus requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and do maintenance for her business.

Venus has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and do maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Berlita

texts.en:
Berlita works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Berlita has been in this business for 26 years now.

In the future, Berlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es: Flor es una excelente cocinera que decidió emprender su restaurant motivada por una amiga que alagó su sazón y una semana después inició su negocio con excelentes resultados,  Flor de 70 años es una dinámica mujer que a primera hora de la mañana se entrega por completo a su negocio e inicia la preparación de platos que a los habitantes del sector donde reside en Malambo, no resisten probarlos, pues su apariencia y aroma que emanan, deja a más de uno convencidos de no perderse esta delicia. Flor cuenta con cinco años en esta actividad, la cual le permite adquirir recursos para su sustento, ella enviudó y con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su negocio logra cubrir los gastos en el hogar. Flor sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y la imagen de su negocio, actualmente realizó una solicitud de crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su primer credikiva que invertirá en víveres; arroz, lentejas, verduras, granos, carnes para contar con un stock que respalde su producción y evitar sobre costos en desplazamientos para realizar  sus compras. Flor es madre de ocho hijos a quienes ofreció bienestar con el fruto de su trabajo y que tiene muchos deseos de seguir luchando por sus sueños.
texts.en:
Flor is an excellent cook who was motivated to start her restaurant by a friend who told her it was the right time. One week later she started her business, with excellent results. Flor is 70 years old, and is a dynamic woman who devotes herself completely to her business. She starts early in the morning, preparing dishes that the residents of her neighborhood in Malambo can't resist trying because their appearance and aroma leave people convinced that this is a delight they cannot miss. Flor has been doing this work for more than five years, and it allows her to earn income to support herself. She is a widow, and with support from her children and her business she is able to pay her household expenses.

Flor dreams of improving her quality of life and the image of her business. She is requesting her first Kiva loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to buy supplies such as rice, lentils, vegetables, grains, and meats. With these items she will have enough stock to support her production and avoid the cost of going out to shop. Flor is the mother of eight children who have benefited from the fruit of her labor. She has a great desire to continue striving for her dreams.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, lentils, vegetables, grains, and meats.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: El señor Domingo tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a su casa y ayuda en las labores agrícolas; tiene 4 hijos, los menores tienen 14 y 4 años y van a la escuela. El Sr. Domingo es un agricultor responsable y muy trabajador y se dedica al cultivo de la tara desde hace 20 años, porque le genera ingresos que le permite sostener a su familia y educar a sus hijos. Dentro de sus sueños está educar y hacer profesionales a sus hijos y convertirse en un productor orgánico. El préstamo le servirá para la compra de abonos orgánicos y así poder incrementar su producción y sus ingresos, contando para ello con el asesoramiento del personal técnico de la Asociación.
texts.en:
Domingo, 41, is married and his wife is a homemaker and helps him with the farm work. They have four children, the youngest of which are 14 and 4 and attend school.

Domingo is a responsible, hard-working farmer who has been growing tara trees for 20 years allowing him to earn an income to support his family and educate his children. His goals include educating his children to become professionals, and becoming an organic producer.

The loan will help him buy organic fertilizer to increase production and income, with the help of the technical personnel at the Association.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his tara tree plantation.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos varios desde hace 11 años el cual vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, que estan cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, anteriormente habia solicitado un credito para mejorar su vivienda, en esta ocasion ella esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia como detergentes, jabones, papel para baño, entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con sus ventas pra obtener mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Adilia, 44 years old, lives in her own house with her son. For the last 11 years, she has sold a variety of products in the streets of different neighborhoods near her house. With the earnings she obtains, Adilia manages to cover some of her household expenses.

Previously, she has solicited a loan to make improvements on her house. On this occasion, Adilia is requesting a new loan to purchase merchandise, such as detergents, soaps, and bathroom paper, among other items, so that she can continue selling and obtain better earnings.

loans.use: buy more merchandise such as detergents, soaps, and bathroom paper, among other products.

loans.name: Smile Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga is 30 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fruits and vegetables for more than 4 years. Nga lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village. And the income from this business is unstable because the output and the price of fruits and vegetables belong to the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Nga faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her income by purchasing more fresh fruits and vegetables to resell.

In 2013, Nga joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nga has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "Smile", which consists of three members.

In the future, Nga hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to increase her income by purchasing more fresh fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:

Cristina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cristina has been raising livestock for 8 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

Marlyn has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Jean Emile

texts.fr:
55 ans, Jean Emile est un père de famille attentionné, responsable et débrouillard. Il est marié et sa femme est marchande de légumes et de charbons de bois. Le couple a six enfants et les deux derniers encore à leur charge sont scolarisés.
Il élève des canards pour fabrication des foies gras. Il exploite ce genre d'activité depuis 1993. Il en possède beaucoup d'années d'expérience. Les fois gras sont des nourritures haut de gamme et cher. Il est très passionné de cette activité. C' est une activité très intéressante et bénéfique.
Le développement et l'extension de cette activité fait partie de l'intention, de Jean Emile.Il voudrait acquérir une très grande ferme et augmenter les nombres de cheptel.
texts.en:
Aged 55, Jean Emile is an attentive, responsible, and resourceful family father. He is married and his wife sells vegetables and charcoal. The couple have six children; the younger two are still living with them and are enrolled in school.

Jean Emile has been raising ducks to make foie gras since 1993. He has a lot of years of experience. Foie gras is a very upmarket, expensive food. Jean Emile is passionate about this business. It is a very interesting and remunerative activity. Developing and expanding the business is part of Jean Emile's dream. He would like to have a very big farm and expand his flock.

loans.use: to buy Mulard ducks, maize, oil, and salt.

loans.name: Hanah

Hannah has been in this business for 10 years. Hannah earns more income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Hannah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Marie Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Marie Jacqueline a 64 ans. Le conjoint qui est un militaire retraité bénéficie d’une pension mensuelle. Leurs deux enfants sont déjà mariés. 
Marie Jacqueline vend des ustensiles de cuisine. Cette activité constitue sa principale source de revenus depuis 9 années. Elle a déjà un lieu de vente fixe à la place de marché. Elle recourt à un prêt pour augmenter et diversifier les stocks de marchandises. Elle connaît déjà les besoins des clients. 
Le couple a pu construire une  maison. Les revenus tirés de l’activité serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie du ménage.
texts.en:
Marie Jacqueline is 64 years old. Her husband, who is a retired military man, receives a monthly pension. Their two children are already married.

Marie Jacqueline sells kitchen utensils. This business has been her primary source of income for the past nine years. She already has a fixed sales point at the market. She is asking for a loan so that she can grow and diversify her inventory. She knows the needs of her customers very well.

The couple have managed to build a house. The income from the business will help them improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils: plates, spoons, cooking pots.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:

She has a rattan making (a vine used for furniture and basket) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Eden is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to purchase additional ratan to make basket for her rattan making business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rattan to weave baskets

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es: Jose de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el posee un taller de satreria el cual esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose, age 52, lives in his own home with his mother.  He has a tailoring workshop located in his place of residence.  He has a lot of customers thanks to the quality with which he makes clothing.  He is able to pay for some of the household expense with what he earns.  

He is asking for a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of cloth, buttons, elastic, etc.  In this way he can continue with his work, which generates good earnings.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, buttons, elastic, a variety of cloth, etc.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras De Patabamba Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS TEJEDORAS DE PATABAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Calca, distrito de Coya y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Sabina continua dedicándose a su  negocio de artesanía, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que mediante sus negocios la socia podrá tener más ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a su clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas, polos entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member is part of the LAS TEJEDORAS DE PATABAMBA communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Calca, district of Coya and department of Cusco. 

The member, Sabina, continues making a living at her craft business. The member is an entrepreneurial and determined woman who, through her businesses, will be able to increase her earnings so that she can continue supporting her family. The member continues selling her merchandise to her customers who seek her, this being the way she can provide for her family. 

The member requests a loan to buy sweaters, t-shirts, and other items.

The members are grateful for the loan provided and they commit to meeting their set payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, t-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Nelly Sobeida

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mar y Cielo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly,  tiene 54  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene5  hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es pescador. 
Doña Nelly es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su  forma de venta es puerta a puerta, siempre le gusta vender mercadería de temporada ya que se vende más rápido y mejoran sus ganancias,  trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual puede ganar sus recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa interior y otras prendas. Tiene seis años en el grupo de crédito, le gusta porque con los  créditos empezó su negocio. Su sueño es tener un carro.
texts.en:
The Mar y Cielo [Sea and Sky] credit group meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches.  The majority of people there are very hardworking and work in jobs related to the sea.

Nelly lives in this area.  She is 54 years old and married.  She has five independent adult children with her husband.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Nelly is a housewife who, in order to get her own spending money, works selling every type of clothing.  She makes her sales door-to-door.  She always likes selling seasonal merchandise because it sells more quickly and improves her earnings.  She works three days a week for two or three hours per day.  She has been working this job, with which she earns some money, for six years now.

This loan is to buy pants, tops, underwear, and other clothing items.  She has been in this credit group for six years.  She likes it because she began her business with these loans.  Her dream is to have a car.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, underwear, and other clothing items.

loans.name: Dinalinda

texts.en:
Dinalinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

She supplements this income with earnings from her buy and sell ginger.

Dinalinda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 39 years old and all her seven children are enrolled in school.

Arlene has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Arlene has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rownea successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rowena dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed & supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elizabeth supplements this income with earnings from her general store, farming rice, and a tricycle passenger business.

Elizabeth dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She has a general store and a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Judy requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Judy dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from farming rice and fattening pigs.

Agnes is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Agnes dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elaine is 42 years old and four of her children are currently in school.

Elaine has a buy-and-sell accessories business in the Philippines. Elaine requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more kinds of accessories to sell in her stall.

Elaine has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Ameliza

texts.en:
Ameliza is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a general store, farming rice and fattening pigs businesses in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ameliza dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 43 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are enrolled in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annaliza has a food market business in the Philippines.

Annaliza requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is 62 years old, widowed, and has four children.

Sanita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Sanita requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds, and other farm supplies.

In the future, Sanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds & farm supplies.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analyn is 53 years old and has one of her children is still in school.

Analyn has a weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Analyn requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials and maintenance for her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Adelfa works hard to support her family. She has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Adelfa is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen food to resell.

Adelfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Si, Si, Si Group

texts.es: Ángela  tiene 26 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella implemento su restaurant en su vivienda hace un año. En el cual ofrece menús económicos y platos extras. En horas de la noche  expende cenas cafés y mates. Ella participa en el grupo  “Si, Si, Si”. El crédito lo invertirá en la renovación de sus utensilios vajillas y cubiertos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Ángela viste buzo negro
texts.en:
Ángela is 26 years old.  She is part of the “Si, Si, Si” credit group.  She is single and has one dependent child.  She started up a restaurant in her home a year ago.  She offers both complete meals and a la carte items.  At night, she offers suppers, coffee, and mate tea.  

She will invest her loan in new utensils, dishes, and tableware.  The credit group is grateful to Kiva investors for the granted loan.  Ángela is wearing a black warm-up jacket.

loans.use: to buy new utensils, dishes, and tableware

loans.name: Nimy

texts.en:
Nimy is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child still in school. Nimy is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nimy has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Nimy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has one child still in school.

Theresa has a buy-and-sell crab business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crabs to sell to her customers. Theresa has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is 53 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Ramona works very hard to provide for her family.

Ramona has a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ramona has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future Ramona would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is 48 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Rima has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rima has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, diapers, spices and other groceries. In the future, Rima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Martha Adelina

texts.es: Martha es una mujer muy alegre y divertida de 27 años de edad ,estado civil soltera madre de  2 niños varones Adriano de 9 años de edad y Xavi de 5 años, ellos están en escuelas fiscales, todos los días en las tardes sale a ofrecer de puerta en puerta con la ayuda de su hijo de 9 años sus productos para poder obtener un ingreso y así poder pagar los gastos de la casa y la educación de los niños, con el crédito Martha comprara productos para una pequeña tienda que esta  empezando ya que no quiere dejar tanto tiempo a sus pequeños solos .así tendría un trabajo estable y seguro que le permita estar al cuidado de sus hijos y de esta manera podrá ahorrar para comprar una casa para sus niños
texts.en:
Martha is a happy and entertaining 27 year old woman. She is single and the mother to two boys Adriano aged 9 and Xavi aged 5 years old who study in state schools. Every day in the afternoon she goes out with her 9 year old son and offers her products door to door. She does this in order to make an income and be able to pay the household expenses and her children's education.

Martha will buy products with the loan for the small store she is starting. She doesn't want to leave her children alone so much and she will have a stable and secure job which will allow her to care for her children. And in this way she can save to buy a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy products for a small store.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás de 51 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos desde hace 4 años, y es lo que le permite sostener la economía de su familia. Nicolás habita en casa de  su propiedad, la cual adquirió hace 16 años, y en ella vive con su esposa y su grupo familiar. Nicolás desea continuar invirtiendo en su negocio, ya que con el crédito anterior logro surtir su tienda, por lo que ofrece mayor variedad de productos mejorando sus ingresos. Por lo anterior Nicolás ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: detergente, golosinas, pasta dental, granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, entre otros productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Nicolas, 51 years old, is a hard-working man who has owned a basic product store for the past 4 years, which is what allows him to sustain his family financially. Nicolas lives in his own house, which he acquired 16 years ago, and he lives there with his wife and family. 

Nicolas would like to continue investing in his business, since with the last loan he was able to stock his store and offer a greater variety of products, increasing his income.  Because of this Nicolas has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in detergent, sweets, toothpaste, basic grains, dairy, meats and other products to stock his store.

loans.use: to invest in detergent, sweets, toothpaste, basic grains, dairy, meats and other products to stock his store.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.en:
Maria Angelica is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school. Maria Angelica has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, pork, spices, bread, bamboo sticks, and other materials for her food production business. Maria Angelica has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, pork, spices, bread, bamboo sticks, and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Analyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more products like body lotion, perfume, powder, underwear, make-up kit, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products like body lotion, perfume, powder, underwear, make-up kit, beauty soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 49 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Bernadeth requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bernadeth has been farming rice for 4 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernadeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 39 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collections.

Jean has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending. Jean aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collections.

loans.name: Fabiola Katiuska

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mar y Cielo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Fabiola, tiene 29  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2  hijos de 12 y 7  años de edad, ambos  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de pescado.
Doña Fabiola para poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella también vende en su lugar de trabajo pues es empleada privada, vende ropa de acuerdo a la temporada ya que tiene más salida y es lo que sus clientes le piden, su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas entre otras prendas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 6 años y le gusta porque el grupo es unido. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The "Mar y Cielo" (Sea and Sky) communal bank meets every two weeks in Jaramijo Canton. The area is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of the residents are very hard-working and make their livings working with the sea.

This is where Señora Fabiola lives. She is 29-years old, married and with her husband has two children, who are 12- and 7-years old. The children attend high school and grade school respectively. Doña Fabiola's husband works in a fish factory.

To get her household ahead, doña Fabiola earns money selling all types of clothing. She sells her merchandise door to door and also at her place of work; she works as a private housekeeper. Doña Fabiola sells clothing according to the season, as she has greater success and that is what her customers request. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil from every two weeks to every month, in accordance with what she needs. Doña Fabiola has been in his business for two years, and it is going very well for her.

Doña Fabiola will employ this loan in the purchase of pants, blouses, shirts and other garments. She has been with her communal bank for six years, and she likes it because the group is very united. Doña Fabiola's dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and other garments.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a widowed woman and 53 years old with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jelly has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like cream, shampoo and maintenance for her business.

Jelly has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like cream, shampoo and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 69 years old, married, and she has three children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Amparo has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 55 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collections.

Editha has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Editha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collections.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 59 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon has a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, diapers, and other groceries.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charmaine

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Charmaine works hard to support her family.

She has a mineral water refilling station business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Charmaine is borrowing 40,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional gallons and pay for laborers' salaries for her mineral water refilling station business.

Charmaine has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons and pay for laborers salaries.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden works hard to support her family. She is single with one child and has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. Eden has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

She has been in this business for one year now. In the future, Eden would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus trea hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 20 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y a posee muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her spouse and three children. She has worked for more than 20 years selling clothing. Her business is located in the main municipal market, and she has many customers due to her good prices. With the income that she earns she is able to pay some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale, so that she can continue with her sales and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta y reparacion de bicicletas desde hace 7 años su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y posee muchos cliente por su buen trabajo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de respuestos y accesorios de bicicleta ya que de ese trabajo es como puede salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Miguel is 42-years old.  He lives in his own home with his wife and son.  Miguel has made his living selling and repairing bicycles for the last seven years.  His business is located near his home, and he has a lot of customers because of how well he performs his work.  Miguel is requesting the loan to purchase spare parts and bicycle accessories.  His work is how he is able to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase spars parts and bicycle accessories.

loans.name: Eduardo De Habich Group

texts.es: Yezela tiene 30 años de edad es soltera con dos hijos dependientes. Ella expende cosméticos a través de catálogos hace 5 años. Ella inicio dicha actividad por medio de su prima. Su mayor deseo es independizarse. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos que estén en oferta. Para expenderlos a un precio que le genere buenas ganancias. el grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Yezela es la segunda persona del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Yezela is 30 years old, single with two dependent children. She has been selling cosmetics by catalog for five years. She started said activity through her cousin. Her greatest dream is to make herself independent. She will invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics that are on sale, to sell them at a price that generates good profits for her. The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan provided. Yezela is the second person from the left side.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessica is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jessica has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to additional capital to buy fish for her fish vending.

Jessica has been in this business for 29 years years. In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional capital to buy fish for her fish vending.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 58 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Epefania is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Epefania has been pig fattening for 16 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Celestina is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Celestina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Celestina requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Celestina has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Celestina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, sugar, softdrinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalie has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Rosalie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Criselda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Criselda is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Criselda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 69 years old and widow with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Lolita has been in this business for 3 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a jewelry retailing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of jewelry to resell.

Rubina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is presenting Rubina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 44 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane  has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Mary Jane has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 37 years old and married with three children, who are presently in school. Judith works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

Judith has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collections.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, cooking fat, flour, bread and other items. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking fat, flour and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking fat, flour and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Milagros

texts.en:
Ma. Milagros is 35 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Ma. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Milagros has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ma. Milagros has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, spices and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Milagros would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim was happy to see how his first loan impacted his business. In fact, expanding his toolkit and using new equipment allowed him to take more projects which significantly improved his business performance. As a result, Salim was able to progress in building his own house. He is still engaged and planning to start his own family as soon as his house is ready.

Today, Salim is asking for a 3,854,912 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. This time, he needs the loan to buy supplies in wood and some iron support brackets that he needs for roof constructions. He is hoping that this loan will help his generate as much income as the first one.

loans.use: to buy supplies in wood and iron support brackets for roof constructions

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 years old and married with four children.  Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, spices and other groceries. 

In the future Cecilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nakho Group

texts.en:
Buakham understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Buakham knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Buakham purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Buakham is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rosa Violeta

texts.es: La Señora Rosa tiene 42 años de  edad, es casada y ayuda a su esposo en las labores agrícolas, tiene 4 hijos de 19, 12, 10 y 5 años de edad, todos van a la escuela. Dentro de sus sueños está mejorar los ingresos de la familia para que sus hijos sigan estudiando. La Sra. Rosa tiene 22 años de experiencia como agricultora, es muy responsable y trabajadora, necesita el préstamo para la compra de abonos orgánicos para la producción de papa y de su bosque de tara y de esta manera lograr una mayor producción y mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Rosa is 42 years old. She is married, and helps her husband with his agricultural work. She has 4 children aged 19, 12, 10, and 5, who are all in school. Among her dreams is to increase her family's income so that her children can continue studying. Rosa has 22 years of experience  as a farmer, and is very responsible and hard-working.
