She needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer to grow potatoes and for her tara trees, so that she will have better production and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to grow potatoes and tara.

loans.name: Union Carapongo Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNION CARAPONGO” se encuentra conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Bertha tiene 27 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche y refrescos de manera ambulatoria hace un año. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sillas y mesas de plástico para brindarles comodidad a sus clientes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Bertha es la segunda persona del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The Union Carapongo group is found made up of members dedicated to retail trade. Bertha is 27 years old, single, with a dependent son. She has worked selling ceviche and soda on foot for a year. She will invest the loan in the purchase of plastic chairs and tables to bring comfort to her customers. The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan provided. Bertha is the second person from the left side.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs and tables.

loans.name: Holalla Dominga

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Holalla, tiene 60 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es empleado público.
Doña Holalla es una mujer que le gusta ganarse la vida con su trabajo, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, ella viaja al Perú a comprar mercadería la misma que una vez que llega a su ciudad sale a vender por la localidad donde tiene a sus clientes, ella también  elabora flores a base de telas y vestidos para muñecas,  además ella compra canastas de mimbre sin pintar y después  ella les adorna en diversos colores y diseños los mismos que luego lleva a entregar a otras ciudades donde le compran toda su mercadería.  Lleva más de 20 años dedicad a estas actividades con la cual se gana la vida, ella está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos pues es así como se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para ir al Perú a  comprar  ropa que es lo que va a invertir este crédito. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes village bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts that are known at national and international levels; a place of famous Panama straw hats. In this place lives Holalla, she is 60 years old and maintains a common-law marriage from which she has three children, independent and of age. The husband is a public employee. Holalla is a woman who likes to earn a living with her work. She works as a trader, selling clothing of all types. She travels to Peru to buy merchandise, the same which once it arrives to her city, she goes out to sell it by the location where she has her customers.

She also makes flowers from fabric and clothes for dolls. Additionally, she buys unpainted wicker baskets and later she adorns them in various colors and designs, which she later takes to introduce to other cities where they buy all of her merchandise. She has more than 20 years' experience dedicated to these activities with which she earns a living. She is very thankful for the institution and for the people that help her with the loans, well, this is how she earns a living.

This loan is to go to Peru to buy clothing, which is what she will invest this loan in. She has been in the village bank since the beginning and likes it because of the help that they always give her with the loans. Her dreams are to have good health and to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Susana dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ngua Group

texts.en:
Seeda understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Seeda knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Seeda purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Seeda is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Up Group

texts.en:
Chinh is 49 years old and she is married with 3 children. Mrs. Chinh has been working in agriculture raising pigs for more than 10 years.
She lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Chinh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase the income by purchasing baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

This is Chinh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standard.Chinh is the group leader of "Up", which consists of seven members.

In the future, Chinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase the income by purchasing baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 39 years old, married with five children. One of whom is in school.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Yolanda aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en: Sreymom’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreymom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, bananas and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more seedlings. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 46 years old and married with one child in school, Melba works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Melba has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as  rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Melba would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from tricycle passenger.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melissa is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Melissa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melissa requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, flour, etc..

Melissa has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Melissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, snack foods, sugar, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. 

Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Keangxaynoy Group

texts.en:
Khamphan understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Khamphan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Khamphan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Khamphan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Pratima And Group

texts.en:
Pratima is a 40-year-old entrepreneur who leads a group of 6 women. Sunita, Pranati, Seema, Deepa and Kanaklata are the proud members of Pratima’s group. They have come together to seek a group loan of Rs. 60,000. Pratima runs a stationery shop in her village. She believes that increasing the stock in her shop will help her earn a better income. This will help mitigate the problem of increasing living expenses. She will also be able to save additional money for her children’s education. Thus Pratima needs a loan to purchase books, pens, paper, etc.

All the members are engaged in their own income generation activities and supporting their family financially. To meet the rising household expenses, they want to increase their income level by increasing their business volume. But they do not have sufficient funds to invest in the expansion of their business. They thus seek a loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of pens, books, etc to expand her stationery shop.

loans.name: Namdeua 1 Group

texts.en:
Viengkhone understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Viengkhone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Viengkhone purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Viengkhone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.fr: Gilda a 31 ans. Elle vit en union libre et n’a pas encore d’enfants. Elle a ouvert une boutique de produits alimentaires sur la route de la régale depuis environ 5 ans. Sa boutique, une référence pour la zone, tantôt avec son positionnement mais aussi pour son attirance à gâter ses clients. Gilda a déjà bénéficié de prêts qui lui ont permis de faire avancer sa boutique. Elle souhaite agrandir davantage son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Tenant compte des différentes demandes de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité un microcrédit en vue d’augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Gilda is 31 years old. She lives together with her partner and does not have children yet. About five years ago she opened a grocery store along the main thruway. Her store is well-known in the area, due to its location but also due to the way Gilda takes care of her clients. Gilda already had prior loans which permitted her to develop her business. She would like to expand her store and improve her quality of life. 

In view of her clients' expectations, Gilda is seeking a microloan in order to increase her merchandise stock.

loans.use: to stock up on bottled juices.

loans.name: Hau's Second Family Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hậu is 54 years old, and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Hậu lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, the market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is unstable because when poultry disease happens, they could die, which leaves her nothing to sell, leading to financial trouble.

The main hardship that Hậu faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2015, Hậu joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standards.

She is the group leader of "Hau's Second Family," which consists of four members.

In the future, Hậu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy motor vehicle repair equipment. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle repair equipment.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is married and has a selling seedlings business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Fe has been in this business for 26 years now.

In the future, Fe would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her selling seedlings business.

loans.name: Xangseang Group

texts.en:
See is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
See and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter See and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  See and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, See and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en: Sokly’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokly works as a table marker and he also does extra work as seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is a married woman. She has five children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, tomatoes, onions, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, tomatoes, and onions. Her business goal is to open other business branches within five years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open other business branches.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Catherine who is in her late 30's is married with one child, who is still in school. She has been a tailor for sixteen years now. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to earn a small monthly profit.
This will Catherine's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on materials for making better clothes for her customers and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.

She used the profits to pay school fees, to repay a loan, take care of her family, to reinvest in business and covered household expenses.She will use this loan to increase on materials to make better suits, jackets etc to fit individual customers.She dreams of opening a vocational school just for tailoring.

Catherine will share this loan with her loan group Torees, which has two members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on materials to make better suits, jackets etc .

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, flour, soda, bread, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

Lenah will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Prisca is 53 years old now.

Prisca has a food vending business in the Philippines. Prisca requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, flour, etc..

Prisca has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Prisca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Floriana is 56 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Floriana has a general store business in the Philippines. Floriana requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Floriana has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Floriana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Azela

texts.en:
Azela is 35 years old and married with two children, Both of whom are in school.

Azela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like noodles, sugar, canned good and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Azela has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Azela aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like noodles, sugar, canned good and other miscellaneous items to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Franciscana De Tzamjuyup Group

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 20 años de edad con una familia de un hijo de un año y seis meses, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.

Francisca (el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace 2 años, este negocio se ubica en el mercado regional. Francisca con el afán de mejorar su servicio hacia sus clientes ha decidido organizar un grupo para juntas solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías tales como: güipiles, cortes y fajas, pues la época navideña ya se acerca por lo que las ventas incrementaran.
Francisca con el préstamo espera fortalecer mejor su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 20-year-old woman, whose family consists of her 18-month-old son. This well-liked family lives in a community in Sololá.

To get ahead, Francisca (first on the left in the photo) earns a living by buying and selling traditional clothing. She has been following this occupation for the past two years. Her business is located in the region's market.

Aiming to improve her customer service, Francisca decided to form a group to request a loan to buy merchandise such as "güipiles" (woven blouses), "cortes" (woven skirts), and "fajas" (woven belts) because the Christmas season is just around the corner, and sales increase during that time of the year.

With this loan, Francisca hopes to strengthen her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing merchandise such as “güipiles”, “cortes”, and “fajas” (woven blouses, skirts, and belts).

loans.name: Vangkhon Group

texts.en: Bounma’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Bounma and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Bounma and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years, filter users like Bounma’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with four children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells potatoes.

He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is John's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more potatoes to sell. His business goal is to own a big cereals shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Take A Chance Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh is 53 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Thanh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because when some poultry disease happens, they could die, which leaves her nothing to sell, and she will be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Thanh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of "Take a Chance," which consists of five members.

In the future, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a Kiva borrower. She has two children and describes herself as dependable. She operates a retail business where she sells utensils.

She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more utensils to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Filipinas

texts.en:
Filipinas is a determined woman. She is 65 years old and lives with her family in the town of Ajuy in Iloilo. She is a mother of six adult children and raised them through buying and selling dried fish. In addition to this, she also owns a sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband is a fisherman and still working for their family.

Filipinas is asking for a loan to buy dried fish to sell. She will also buy basic grocery items such as sugar, coffee, toiletries, spices, canned goods, noodles, chips, candies and biscuits to enhance her sales. Thus, she dreams to improve their livelihood for their future needs so that when they get old and unable to go to work she will have already saved enough money.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, grocery items such as sugar, coffee, toiletries, spices, canned goods, noodles, chips, candies and biscuits.

loans.name: Isabel Valentina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Isabel, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. 
Doña Isabel es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos para que no le falte nada a sus hijos, ella trabaja lavando de ropa ajena y le ayuda a una señora que vende comida, también en su casa tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la cual se gana buena parte de sus ingresos, este negocio lo tiene desde hace ya 10 años y gracias a los créditos pudo mejorarlo ya que antes no tenía muchos productos y actualmente tiene su tienda muy surtida, ella espera seguirla mejorando para después de un tiempo dedicarse solo a su tienda y a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para surtir su negocio.  Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que  les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Jose Cesario Reyes Loan group meets every two weeks in the county of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts that are nationally and internationally renowned. It's the birthplace of the famous Panama straw hat. This is where 32 year old Isabel lives, a single mother of two children ages 10 and 4. The elder child attends school and the younger is in kindergarden.

Isabel is a woman who has always enjoyed working to earn her own living so that her kids don't lack for anything. Her work is doing laundry for people and she helps a woman who sells food. Also she has a small supply store in her home where she makes a good chunk of her income. She's had this business for over 10 years and thanks to the loans she was able to improve it because she didn't use to have many products and now her store is very well-stocked. Her hope is to continue improving it so that she can eventually dedicate herself to just the store and her kids.

She'll use this loan to buy supplies to stock her business. She's been in the loan group for 4 years and she enjoys it because of the help that this institution provides. Her dream is to always provide the best for her children.

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 22 years old. She is married and blessed with one child. Her business is a beauty salon and she has been in this business for two years. She earns a monthly income of thirty five thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use part of the loan to buy shampoos, weaves, braids, hair cream etc. for the salon and the other part to pay school fees for her child.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to participate in the family budget. Her hopes and dreams are to increase her business earnings.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, weaves, braids, hair cream etc. for her salon as well as to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en:
Zohrab is 50 years old and lives in Sevan, a city in the Gegharkunik region, with his beloved wife. She is employed as a saleswoman. They have a daughter who is already married. Zohrab is also employed, and he works simultaneously in two places: He works as a fireman and he is also a forester at the city’s park.

Zohrab has great need of financial support and greatly hopes that he will find this help thanks to his partnership with Kiva lenders. His wife needs to undergo a course of treatment after a surgery. That course of treatment is a rather expensive one, and Zohrab will be so thankful to receive this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams (AMD) for making that repayment for his wife.

loans.use: to pay for a course of post-surgical treatment for his wife.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself as committed and operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more clothing stock. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more clothing stock.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia vive actualmente en casa de sus padres, trabaja como vendedora en un local comercial de manera a poder tener los medios para cubrir los gastos de su carrera, ella es una persona que lucha y se esfuerza para poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Estudia la carrera de arquitectura y sueña con poder ser reconocida en el ámbito de su carrera.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar materiales de estudios y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Patricia currently lives in her parents' home, and works as a salesperson at a commercial site so that she can obtain the means to cover expenses for her studies. She's somebody who fights and strives to become a professional and productive member of society. She's studying the field of architecture and dreams of being renowned in her field. She's requesting this loan to be able to purchase school supplies and that way continue with her studies the way she has been.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 24 years old and the mother of two school aged children. She is a housewife, focusing on her family and kids. Her husband is a soldier in the Lebanese army and works in parallel as a blacksmith.

At this time, Ferial is in real need of a little help from Kiva. For that reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees for the school year. She said that she is happy that she will be able to ensure them a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees for the school year

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a married man and has 4 children. He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes, egg plant, spinach and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be occasional water scarcity. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more land for farming. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  He repaid his previous loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy more land for farming.

loans.name: Benon Kabututu

texts.en:
Benon is a married farmer and has six children. He derives survival and income for family support from his plantation and produces about 400,000 UGX per month. He has applied for 1,500,000 UGX to buy mulch to improve his plantation.

Benon is a hard working and focused man who is focusing his energies to make his banana plantation a model in his location.

loans.use: to buy mulch.

loans.name: Jumka

texts.en: Jumka is 50 years old. He is unemployed and lives alone in the Zugdidi district. Jumka has decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 400 USD. With the received credit he will purchase seasonal fruits in order to resell them and generate income. Jumka is very motivated and hopes that the business will be profitable.

loans.use: to start a business reselling fruits.

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.en:
The Gold Group in Chorkor, a community within greater Accra, the capital of Ghana, with a quick boost in sales, seeks a loan to extend their businesses.

Marry, who sell pastries, is a single parent who works hard to meet the standard of nourishment of her customers. Along with her fellow members with regard to regular repayment of the loan, she seeks the help of Kiva lenders through ID Ghana for a loan to buy enough items to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy enough items to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 28-year-old married Lebanese woman living only with her husband. Her husband works as an employee in a company, and he is responsible for the family expenses and represents the main income source in the family, to have a good lifestyle.

In order to pay her technical fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that her target is to achieve higher positions and be able to support her husband financially.

loans.use: to pay her technical fees

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en:
Zhora is a hardworking and skilled farmer who lives in Ddmashen, a village in the Geharkunik region, with his wife. Their two children are already married, and they live with their families.

For a long time, Zhora used to work as a hairdresser, but even during his younger years he never stopped farming. On his farm he has cows, a heifer, sheep, pigs and chickens. He also has a plot of land on which he is busy with cultivation of potatoes and tomatoes.

Zhora is especially popular because of the high quality of his farm’s meat. A lot of butchers come from the city in order to buy particularly his farm’s meat, which is always fresh and testy. His wife also sells their farm's milk, cheese and eggs.

Zhora will be thankful if Kiva lenders help him to store fodder for his farm cattle for winter; and with this loan of 200,000 Armenian drams (AMD), he will buy and store fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy and store fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 36 years old and lives with his big family in Zovaber village of the Gegharkunik region. Karen is specialized in pedagogue and coaching, but has never worked in this area. Instead Karen has always been engaged in farming and is a master in his work.

Karen is married and lives with his wife, two school-aged sons, his parents and also his grandmother. Karen's farm is large and requires a lot of work. Consequently, he has a lot of helpers. He has cows, a calf, a heifer, lambs, sheep and chickens. Land cultivation also demands a lot of time and effort since he has a large plot of land on which he cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers, greens, garlic, onions and cabbage. These vegetables Karen takes to the city wholesale market and sells them mainly to re-sellers. His wife and mother sell his other farm products, including milk, curd, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs, directly from the farm.

Karen also manages to earn money thanks to his tractor with which he does different hired agricultural work in his village. Unfortunately his tractor is now out of order. This Kiva loan of 700,000 Armenian drams will be great for him to receive as with this amount he will repair this tractor which provides a rather good income for his large family.

loans.use: to repair his tractor which he uses to earn a good income for his large family

loans.name: Nashonnex

texts.en:
Nashonnex is a married man with 6 children. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes, potatoes and also keeps cows. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda es de una familia humilde y trabajadora, está estudiando la carrera de derecho y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ser una profesional útil que ayude a las demás personas.
Ella lucha y se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos a través de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de gastos de su tesis, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Griselda is from a humble, hard-working family and is studying the field of law and through her studies she aims to become a professional and productive member of society who helps others. She's fighting and striving to improve she and her loved ones' standard of living through her studies.

She's asking for this loan to invest it in paying for her thesis expenses, and that way be able to cover her costs.

loans.use: To pay expenses for her thesis.

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
Salha is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman and mother of five children; three of them still attend school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life.

Despite the bad financial situation, she is requesting a loan today from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register them for the coming school year, which makes her feel very optimistic.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Matilde Flora

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Matilde, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio local.
Doña Matilde es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida con su esfuerzo, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo la misma que sale a vender ciertos días a la semana y también vende en su casa, también en su casa tiene  una copiadora para este servicio, allí vende helados, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas. Así ella logra ganarse la vida de una forma honrada y esto gracias a los créditos que siempre le ayudan a ir aumentando su negocio, razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación y con las personas que contribuyen para que ella obtenga su crédito.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, papel para la copiadora, gaseosas y helados para surtir su negocio.  Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que  les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Cesareo Jose Reyes meets every fortnight in the Canton of Montecristi which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts that are recognized nationally and internationally. It is also the home of the famous Panama hat.

Matilde lives here and is 63 years old, married and has five grown up children to the relationship, one of them still lives with her. Her husband works in the local municipality.

Matilde is a woman who has always liked making a living through her own efforts. She earns a living through selling clothes of all types which she goes out to sell on certain days of the week and also sells at home. She also offers a copier service from home as well as selling ice cream, juices, soft drinks and more.

This is how she manages to make an honest living and she is thankful for the loans that always help her to gradually keep growing her business. This is why she is very grateful to the foundation and the people who contribute to the loan she will receive.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, copier paper, soft drinks and ice cream for her business. Since joing the Credit Group she has appreciated the help provided to her by the institution. Her dreams are continuing to move forward.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, copier paper, soft drinks and ice cream.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita is a 52-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in a town of Ajuy in Iloilo, Philippines, where fishing is one of the most common livelihoods in most communities. Juvita and her husband are undertaking this livelihood to sustain each day.

They have three children: two adults and one school-aged child that still need their support. That is why Juvita is asking for funds to buy a fishing net and a new engine for their fishing boat so that she and her husband can enhance their catch.

Definitely, she wishes in the future to improve their livelihood to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 30 years old and lives with her parents in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. She graduated from financial college in the faculty of banking work in Sevan city. She has worked as an accountant for 7 years. Her father works in construction and her mother works at the bread factory as a baker.

The flat where Lusine lives with her parents is in great need of repair. The apartment’s windows are in the worst condition since they are very old wooden windows. With the coming of the cold winter season the windows cause the flat to be very cold and uncomfortable despite heating. With the warmth disappearing quickly, they also create extra expense to heat the flat. Lusine is requesting this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to install new windows in their flat to provide comfort and warmth for her beloved parents.

loans.use: to install new windows in her flat to provide comfort and warmth for her beloved parents.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y por medio de su carrera quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas que necesiten atención en su salud. Siempre quiso ayudar a los demás, es por ello que le gusta mucho su carrera.
Su aspiración es llegar a culminar su carrera y  trabajar como profesional de marera a llegar a ser útil a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder luchar por alcanzar sus anhelos.
texts.en: Evangelina is from the city of Villarrica. She is studying the nursing career. Through this career she wants to help people who need attention with their health. She always wanted to help others, and this is why she likes her career so much. Her goal is to finish her career and be able to serve others. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for college tuition fees, and in this way work hard to reach her wishes.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 57 year old Lebanese widow woman who lives alone with no children. After she lost her husband, she became the main income provider in the family, so she decided to start a housecleaning business as per client demand. She also works as a housekeeper in a local company for extra income.

She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. Today she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a vacuum cleaner for her business, with the aim to increase her productivity and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner for her business

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo viene de una familia humilde y sacrificada, él está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios.
Arnaldo es una persona que se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos a través de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa manera poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is from a humble, hard-working family who's studying the field of accounting and through his studies he wants to be able to help his family.
Arnaldo is somebody who strives to improve he and his family's standard of living through his studies. He's applying for this loan to be able to pay the fees for his degree and that way continue with his studies the way he's been doing.

loans.use: To pay for college expenses.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hard-working woman who earns a living through tailoring services. She offers dressmaking, dress adjustments and other tailoring services. She is also seeking ways to improve her quality of life and so wants to continue to operate her rickshaw transportation services. This service serves as supplemental income for her family.

She is married and has two children ages 9 and 15. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to invest in materials like thread, sewing needles and to pay rickshaw registration. In this way she hopes to improve her financial income. With the loan she will be able to cater to more customers, enabling her income to improve. She will be able to save in order to purchase another sewing machine, which is vital in her day to day livelihood activity.

Gilda successfully paid back her previous loan and has requested a new loan to further build her businesses for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to invest in materials like thread, sewing needles and to pay for her rickshaw registration

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is now enjoying working in a newly upgraded studio decor, thanks to the previous loan she got. She is very proud of the new studio setting that is providing her as well as her customers with improved working conditions during photo shoots. She is still single and working hard on seeing her business grow.

She now needs a loan of 1,234,327 Lebanese pounds (LBP) from Kiva partner Ibdaa to buy a new professional camera that takes higher quality photos than the one she currently owns. Rima is a perfectionist and can now afford to start investing in improving her work's quality. She believes this new loan will help her fulfill her ambition of seeing her clientele increase and her studio become one of the best in the area.

loans.use: to buy a new professional camera for her studio

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en:
Mayis is 30 years old and lives in Tsaghkunk, a village in the Gegharkunik region. He is not married and he lives with his parents and his brother’s family.

Mayis used to work as a locksmith, but now he is farming and is also greatly interested in land cultivation. His family members help him with the farm work. He takes care of cows, calves, heifers, bulls, sheep and chickens.

With his mother, Mayis sells milk, meat, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, butter and eggs to their regular customers from the village. From his land, Mayis manages to have good harvests of potatoes, thanks to his hard work and skill.

Since they live in a large family, each member of it does his/her best to enlarge their income, and they help each other very much. Now Mayis is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams (AMD) as he has a plan of buying a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Idibek

texts.ru: Идибек счастливый отец. У него трое детей. Старшая дочка вышла замужем, а младшей 18 лет, третий еще ребенок. Идибек жизнелюбивый и воспитанный человек. Ему 45 лет. Он вместе с семьей проживает на районе Бохтар. В районе Бохтар прекрасная погода для сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Бохтар солнечный район, жители на поле выращивает семечки, хлопок и другие растение. Идибек занимается животноводством, потому что он продвигает деятельность родителей. Он уже три года выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Идибек уже хорошо знает свою работу. Он покупает скота и откармливает их 2-3 месяцев, потом вывозит их на продажу. Идибек за счет кредита хочет приобрести несколько скота и расширить деятельность. Идибек ждет поддержку с Вашей стороны. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Idibek is the happy father of three children.  His oldest daughter is already married, his second child is 18, and his third is still a young boy.  Idibek is well educated and he has a positive attitude towards life.  He is 45 years old and lives with his family in the Bohtar district of Tajikistan.  This particular district enjoys a beautiful weather and plenty of sunshine, which is suitable to agriculture.  Local residents typically grow sunflowers, cotton and various crops.  

Idibek is involved in animal husbandry, an activity he took over from his parents.  He has been raising cattle for three years already and knows his job very well.  He buys livestock and feeds his animals over a two to three-month period of time, before taking them for resale.  Idibek is planning to use his loan to buy a few more head of cattle and expand his activity.  He is awaiting your support and relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and expand his animal husbandry activity.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar es una mujer de 47 años trabajadora y madre de dos hijas de 25 años. Estudió contabilidad, esta soltera y actualmente vive en Pachuca, Hidalgo en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
María inició su negocio hace 7 años y prosperaba muy bien. Hace poco tiempo, tuvo que cubrir gastos médicos de una de sus hijas ya que necesitaba una cirugía y esto le provocó bajas en las ventas de su tienda.
María solicitó un crédito para ayudarse a comprar mercancía y así hacer que las ventas se incrementaran y pudiera recuperar la pérdida de ganancias que había sufrido. Hoy su negocio ha vuelto a prosperar y sueña con tener otra tienda pero más grande y así hacer fluir más su dinero.
Su motivación más grande son sus hijas, quienes ya no dependen económicamente de ella pero les ayuda en lo que necesiten, así como sus ganas de tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia teniendo una situación económica más estable.
texts.en:
María del Pilar is a hardworking woman of 47 years and the mother of two daughters, both 25 years old. She studied accounting, is single and now lives in Pachuca, Hidalgo where she has a grocery store.

María started her business seven years ago and it has prospered wonderfully. Recently, she had to cover some medical expenses for one of her daughters who needed surgery, and this led to lower sales in her store.

María requested a loan to help her buy merchandise and thus improve her sales so that she could recoup the loss of income that she has suffered. Today her business has returned to flourishing and she dreams of having another store, but bigger so as to have more money flowing.

Her greatest motivation are her daughters, who are no longer economically dependent on her, although she does help them in whatever they need. She wants to have a better quality of life for herself and her family by having a more stable economic situation.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and stock her store.

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado CRECER está en su  primer ciclo  del programa de Comité de Mujeres, donde todas trabajan para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Iluminada, una mujer muy sacrificada que con lucha y trabajo arduo está saliendo adelante, comenta que la única forma que vio de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida es a través de la capacitación y l trabajo en conjunto del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas y comenta que por medio de sus ventas da a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
La Sra. Iluminada pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas usadas para poder revender, como remeras, pantalones, jeans y otros, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida
texts.en:
The group called Crecer (To Grow) is in its first cycle of the program of Comité de Mujeres (Committee of Women) where all work to get ahead.  They are part of a survey to eliminate poverty, to be able to improve their living conditions and that of their families.

One of the members is la Señora Iluminada.  A very self sacrificing woman who strives and works arduously, she is getting ahead.  She says that the only way she saw to improve her living conditions is through the training and the work in conjunction of the group.  She works selling used clothing and says that through her sales, she gives her family a dignified life without hardships.

La Señora Iluminada is requesting this loan to be able to buy used clothing to be able to resell, such as shirts, pants, jeans, and others.  She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell such as shirts, pants, jeans, and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De La Paz Group

texts.es:
El grupo está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, esta además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza esforzándose y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luz quien poco a poco ha podido mejorar y lucha para poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados y pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas y calzados  para su negocio, lo que le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas  el cual ayudara a  mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is in its first cycle of the program of the committee of women. In addition, it is in the program for the elimination of poverty, striving and struggling to improve the conditions of life.

One of the members is Luz who little by little has been able to improve and fight to give her family a better quality of life. She makes a living from the sale of clothing and footwear, and she is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing and footwear for her business. This will help her increase her sales which in turn will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Sabias Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este unido y luchador grupo, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Miguela quien hace y vende tortas, es muy buena en su trabajo y por eso ya tiene muy buena clientes que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos y gracias a ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero se ha abierto camino y ya es muy conocida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus tortas, como ser harina, huevos, manteca, leche y otros, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben todas y cada una de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
There are 17 women who make up this united and determined group. In addition, they are in the program for the elimination of poverty, struggling and making an effort to be able to improve their and their loved ones’ living conditions.

One of the members is Miguela, who makes and sells cakes. She is good at her work and so already has very good customers who always put in many orders, and thanks to this she has the means to be able to help her family. She comments that she began with little, but she has made her way and is already very well-known.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase supplies to make her cakes, such as flour, eggs, butter, milk, and others, to be able to continue meeting her customers’ orders. She is thankful for the opportunity that they all are receiving and each one for being able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, butter, milk, and other products to make cakes to sell.

loans.name: Olmaskhan

texts.ru: Олмасхан, 64 года, замужем, 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, с 2004 года начала заниматься торговлей одеждой на вещевом рынке, после событий 2010 года, перешла на другой рынок, но вид деятельности не поменяла. Контейнер Олмасхан собственный, в обороте есть товар на 400,000 сом (KGS). Товар Олмасхан возит с Бишкека или закупает в Турции. Ежемесячная прибыль Олмасхан составляет 23,000 сом (KGS). Она решила к зимнему сезону приобрести одежду, поэтому и обратилась в Банк "Бай Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от бизнеса помогут Олмасхан развить ее бизнес за счет дальнейшего увеличения ассортимента товаров.
texts.en: Olmaskhan is 64, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a college education.  In 2004, she began selling clothes at the garment market.  After the events of 2010, she moved to a different market but continued the same activity.  Olmaskhan has her own retail outlet and her inventory is worth 400,000 som (KGS).  She orders merchandise from Bishkek or imports from Turkey.  She makes a monthly income of 23,000 som (KGS).  With the start of the winter season, she has decided to turn to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and she has requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  The earnings from her business will allow her to further increase her inventory and ultimately expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy winter's clothes in order to increase her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La Joven Aurelia de 32 años de edad es soltera  vive en la ciudad de Nacaome, Honduras  se dedica desde hace 05 años a la venta de tortillas al por mayor, la señora entrega tortillas a los restaurantes que son sus principales clientes.
La señora Aurelia  es una mujer  trabajadora  con muchos deseos de salir adelante y agradece a  Prisma por darle la oportunidad de este crédito.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de granos básicos como frijoles, arroz, maíz, etc. Con el apoyo del crédito pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio. Y así poder seguir mejorando su negocio.

Su sueño es comprarse una casa en el futuro.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  2015.
texts.en:
The young Aurelia is 32, single and lives in the city of Nacaome, Honduras. For five years, she's earned a living selling tortillas in bulk, taking tortillas to restaurants, which are her main customer.

Aurelia is a hardworking woman with many hopes to get ahead, and thanks Prisma for giving her the opportunity for this loan. She's seeking a loan to buy basic goods such as beans, rice, corn, etc.

With support from the loan, she plans to stock and improve her business, and therefore continue improving her business. Her dream is to buy a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy basic goods and groceries.

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Isabel está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de Comités, es un grupo nuevo donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estelvina quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, y sumado a la venta de lencerías que hace, está esforzándose por poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia. Estelvina es una mujer muy trabajadora que se viene ganando la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar lencerías de todo tipo, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y tener siempre una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Santa Isabel is in its first cycle of the program of committees.  It is a new group where all are in the program to eliminate poverty, striving to be able to improve their living conditions and that of their loved ones.

One of the members is la Señora Estelvina, who through strife and continuous work, and in addition to selling lingerie that she makes, she is striving to be able to improve the living condition of herself and her family.  Estelvina is a very hardworking woman who is earning a living in a dignified and honest way.

She is requesting is loan to be able to buy lingerie of all kinds, to be able to continue with her sales and to always have a good variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a variety of lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuela, de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera, se dedica a la agricultura porque ese fue el oficio que le enseñaron sus padres, tuvo 5 hijos y ellos le ayudan a realizar sus actividades diarias en la agricultura y la ganadería.

Manuela, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en la mañana y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a ordeñar las vacas y a elaborar queso o atol que vende en los alrededores de su comunidad.

Manuela, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla, para obtener más leche para vender y mejorar sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Manuela, sueña con comprar más ganado y un terreno para pastarlos.
texts.en:
Manuela is 60 years old, and she studied antil 6th grade. She is single and she works in agriculture as this is the work that her parents taught her. She has five children and together they carry out her daily activities in agriculture and raising livestock. Manuela does her agricultural work in the mornings and during the afternoon she milks the cows and makes cheese or atole (a traditional hot drink) that she sells around her community. Manuela needs the loan to buy a heifer to obtain more milk to sell and improve her income for the sustenance of the family.

Manuela dreams of buying more cattle and land for pasture.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to obtain more milk to sell.

loans.name: Kenzhegul

texts.ru: Кенжегул, 35 лет, замужем, многодетная мама 6 детей, старшему - 14 лет, самой младшей дочери - 6 лет. У Кенжегул высшее образование, работает в школе учителем. Также уже 8 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. В хозяйстве Кенжегул есть земельный участок мерою 1,0 Га, где она выращивает ячмень и 4 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. Кенжегул очень трудолюбива, отзывчива и жизнерадостна. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS), на приобретение 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят ей увеличить хозяйство и приобрести автомобиль для семьи.
texts.en:
Kenzhegul is 35, married, and the mother of a large family (she has six children).  Her oldest child is 14 and her youngest daughter is 6.  Kenzhegul has a college education and works as a school teacher.  She has also been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry for the past eight years.  She grows barley on one hectare of land and she has four cows, 10 sheep and two horses.

Kenzhegul is very hardworking, caring, and she has a positive attitude towards life.  She has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows and increase her livestock headcount.  She will use the earnings from her loan to expand her farming business and to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Maria Victorina

texts.es:
María, de 50 años de edad, nunca estudio, actualmente vive con su hija, yerno y sus nietas las cuales están estudiando y su esposo trabaja.

María, tenía un puesto de frutas y verduras desde hace seis meses, se le presentaron problemas de salud por lo cual tuvo que dejar el negocio y ahora se dedica a lavar y a planchar ropa los fines de semana.

María, necesita el dinero para poder instalar el negocio de verduras y frutas nuevamente e iniciar su negocio con el cual espera que mejore su situación económica y así no tendrá necesidad de planchar y lavar ropa.


María, sueña con tener un puesto más formal para vender de frutas y verduras, para estar a la disposición de sus clientes y que sus nietos puedan superarse y puedan ser personas de éxito.
texts.en:
María, 50 years old, never went to school. She is currently living with her daughter, son-in-law and granddaughters who are going to school and her husband works.

María has had a fruit and vegetable stand for six months. Some health problems came up, so she had to leave the business and now she works washing and ironing clothing on weekends.

María needs the money to be able to establish her vegetable and fruit business again and begin her business with which she expects to improve her economic situation and, so, not have the need to iron and wash clothes.

María dreams of having a more formal stand to sell fruits and vegetables, to be available for her customers, and that grandchildren will be able to improve themselves and be successful people.

loans.use: to be able to establish her vegetable and fruit business again.

loans.name: Santo Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado santo rey está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, esforzándose todas por poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Venancia, quien a través de las capacitaciones y verificaciones de la fundación paraguaya, y los comportamientos de una mujer exitosa, se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, sumado a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender.
Pide este préstamo ya que necesita comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando su humilde emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called "Santo Rey" is in its sixth cycle of the program of the committee of women, in which all are taking the challenge for the elimination of poverty, all striving to be able to grow and improve their conditions of life and those of their loved ones.

One of the members is Venancia, who through the trainings and verifications of the Fundacion Paraguaya and the behavior of a successful woman, in addition to the sale of meals which she herself makes and later goes out to sell, finds herself improving her impoverished situation.

She requests this loan since she needs to buy supplies in order to be able to make her meals, such as meat, condiments, baked goods, vegetables, and other things. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to be able to continue improving her humble entrepreneurship.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making meals, such as meat, condiments, baked goods, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Aramicila

texts.es:
La señora Aramicila, vive con su esposo en una comunidad de  Santa cruz de yojoa, al norte de Honduras se dedica a la venta de tamales actividad que realiza de manera ambulante. 

Doña Aramicila necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, arroz, condimentos, etc. Para elaborar sus productos y poder invertir en su actividad ya que quiere extenderse más con su producto  por eso necesita la ayuda y está muy contenta con esta oportunidad que se le brinda. 
	
Doña Aramicida espera con esta inversión poder crecer con su negocio para seguir en la lucha día con día y  para tener una mejor calidad de vida. está muy contenta.

El sueño de Aramicila es lograr tener su negocio estable para ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes y ofrecer variedad en comidas.

                                                                              


Santa Cruz de Yojoa,  Honduras – Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
Aramicila lives with her spouse in a community of Santa Cruz de Yojoa in northern Honduras. She works in tamale sales as street vendor. She needs the loan to be able to invest in her work, now that she needs to expand her product to the surrounding areas. As such, she needs help and is very happy for this opportunity that it will provide. 

Aramicila needs the loan to buy corn, rice, condiments, etc. She needs help in order to prepare her products and be able to invest in her activity, because she wants to expand more with her product. She is really happy to have this opportunity.

Aramicia hopes with this investment to grow her business to keep working in order to have a better quality of live. She is very happy.
	
Aramicila's dream is to achieve a stable business to offer better service to her customers and to offer a variety of food.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - September 2015

loans.use: para la compra de maíz, arroz, condimentos, etc. para su negocio.

loans.name: Renacer 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo es relativamente nuevo, las integrantes se fijaron como meta poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias, ellas se sienten muy contentas de formar parte del programa de comités de la fundación paraguaya.
Andresa es una de las que integra este grupo, tiene una despensa con todo tipo de productos, y también una bodega con bebidas de todo tipo, comenta que gracias a sus ventas tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna, a su vez Andresa está contenta ya que por medio de su trabajo está creciendo poco a poco.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa con verduras, frutas, carne, condimentos, panificados y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir dando a sus clientes lo que ellos piden y de esa forma tener los ingresos que necesita para poder continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group is relatively new, and the members have set a goal of being able to improve their living conditions as well as those of their families. They feel very happy to be part of Fundación Paraguaya’s committees program.

Andresa is one of the members of this group. She has a store stocked with all kinds of products as well as a grocery store with all types of drinks. She says that thanks to her sales, she has the means to be able to provide her loved ones with a decent life and, in turn, Andresa is happy that she is already growing little by little through her work.

She is requesting this loan to stock her store with vegetables, fruits, meat, condiments, baked goods, and other products. In this way, she’ll be able to continue providing her customers with what they request, and have the income she needs to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, meat, condiments, baked goods, and other products for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa Angélica con 38 años de edad,de estado civil soltera ,vive junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Morropón,provincia de Morropón,departamento de Piura,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Rosa Angélica se dedica a la venta de abarrotes,leche,azúcar,arroz,chifles,etc,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 6 años.Solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo, compra de mercadería: gaseosas, chifles, arroz, azúcar, panteones,galletas, golosinas ya que se acercan las fiestas,unificar deuda de caja Paita y poder trabajar con Edpyme Alternativa, así realizar mejoras en su vivienda.

Rosa Angélica es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa Angelica is 38 years old and is single. She lives with her parents in the Morropón district in the Morropón province in the department of Piura in Peru. The majority of the inhabitants of this location earn a living in farming, trade, and cattle raising.

Rosa Angelica earns a living selling groceries, milk, sugar, rice, chifles [Peruvian snack], etc. and she has more than six years of experience in the industry. She is requesting a loan to invest in working capital and to buy merchandise: sodas, snacks, rice, sugar, Christmas cakes, cookies, and candies since the holidays are coming, and to refinance a cash debt to Palta and work with Edpyme Alternativa and to make home improvements.

Rosa Angelica is a current member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: sodas, snacks, rice, sugar, Christmas cakes, cookies.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer con 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Elmer cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Elmer se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia en el rubro hace 10 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos e invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Elmer es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado varios créditos, los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Elmer, 30 years old, in a common-law marriage, lives in his own home along with his spouse and youngest child in the Cañaris District, Ferreñafe Province, and Lambayeque Department, Peru. Elmer can count on many good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants of this town mainly make a living from agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

Elmer makes a living from agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee, with experience in the business for 10 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and to invest in the maintenance of his farm. Thus, he will get higher yields.

Elmer is a recurrent associate of Edpyme Alternativa. He has managed a variety of loans, which he has paid off punctually.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso con 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Colasay,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Alfonso se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y pagos de peones. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Alfonso es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,ha manejado dos créditos los cuáles los canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 39 years old, he is in a common law marriage, and he lives in his own house together with his spouse and their two children, in the district of Colasay, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, Peru.  The majority of the inhabitants of this place work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle.

Alfonso works in agriculture, specifically in growing coffee, with experience in the job for the past 10 years.  He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers and pay workers.  In this way, he will obtain better yield.

Alfonso is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa.  He has had two loans which he has paid off punctually.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay workers.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto con 61 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus 02 hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural.
