Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Jacinto se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 10 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera podrá realizar mejoras en su cultivo e incrementar sus rendimientos.

Jacinto es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, ha manejado 06 créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 61 years old.  He is in a common law married, and he lives with his spouse and their two children in the district of Cañaris, province of Ferreñafe, department of Lambayeque, Peru, in a rural area.  The majority of the inhabitants of this place work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle.

Jacinto works in agriculture, specifically in growing coffee, with experience in the job for more than 10 years.  He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers and to invest in the maintenance of his farm.  In this way to will improve his crop and increase his yields.


Jacinto is a recurrent member for Edpyme Alternativa.  He has had 6 loans which he has paid off punctually.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha is a Lebanese, married woman. She’s 32, and she lives with her husband and two children still in school. Her husband represents the main income source to help her family to meet the needs of life and to be able to enhance their way of living.

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for the school stationery and to buy her children books. This is her first loan, and she plans to take more Kiva loans in the future to help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay for school stationery and to buy her children books.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a farm where she grows cabbages, bananas and other vegetables. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a su casa y apoya en las labores agrícolas; tiene 4 hijos de 19, 10, 7 y 5 años, tres van a la escuela. Es un agricultor alegre, colaborador y cumplidor de su palabra. Tiene 20 años en el negocio de la tara y lo que más le gusta es dedicarse a la producción orgánica. Dentro de sus sueños está dar una buena educación a sus hijos y que sean profesionales. El préstamo le servirá para la compra de abono orgánico para incrementar su producción de tara y por lo tanta generar mayores ingresos para su familia y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
El señor Julio is 45 years old.  He is married and his wife works in their house and helps with the farm chores.  He has four children, 19, 10, 7, and 4 years old.  Three of them go to school.  He is a cheerful farmer, partner, and keeper of his words.  He has 20 years of experience in the business of tara (a type of tree), and what he likes most is to work in organic production.  Among his dreams is to be able to give a good education to his children and that they become professionals.

The loan will allow him to buy organic fertilizers to increase his production of tara and over all improve the income for his family and the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers to fertilize his tara forest.

loans.name: Oscar Segundo

texts.es: Oscar tiene 30 años de edad, es de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Elvis de 12 años e Ingrid de 10 años, se dedica hace 10 años a fabricar muebles en madera, aunque es un trabajo muy duro, el lo realiza con esmero para obtener  buenos resultados, solicita el crédito para la compra de madera y materiales q utiliza para la elaboración de muebles y así poder incrementar su negocio y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their two children, Elvis who is 12 years old and Ingrid who is 10 years old.

He has made a living for 10 years manufacturing wooden furniture. Although it is difficult work, he carries it out painstakingly to obtain good results.

He is requesting the loan to purchase wood and materials that he uses for the manufacture of furniture, and thus grow his business and be able to satisfy his family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the manufacture of wooden furniture.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abubakar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Abubakar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Abubakar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 24-year-old, Lebanese, married woman living with her husband. She is the mother of two young children. Her husband is the main income source to fulfill the necessities of life, and till now, he earned a fair revenue. As for her, she is dedicated only for her children.

That’s why today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register them for the coming school year, which makes her very optimistic and willing to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Roudy

texts.en:
Roudy is a 37-year-old, married woman living with her husband. She has three school-aged children. Her husband represents the main income provider; he is a hard worker in order to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s registration fees at school and buy their books. She said that she is very happy and willing to always benefit from Kiva’s loans to continue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children’s registration fees at school and buy their books.

loans.name: Analina

texts.en:
Analina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising livestock.

Analina dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 62 years old and widow with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional pigs and feeds.

Aida has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from general store and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old, married with seven children. One of whom is in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Teresita has a general store business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, spices and other personal care products to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, spices and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
Rosmeri, de 36 años edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a la situación económica de su familia no pudo continuar sus estudios, está casada y es madre de tres hijos, pero solo dos estudian y su esposo se dedica a trabajar como docente en una escuela de la comunidad donde viven. 

Rosmeri, tiene 5 años de experiencia en el comercio de productos básicos del hogar, esta actividad la aprendió por si sola, a raíz que no tenia una fuente de ingresos decidió poner su propio negocio, empezó con pocos productos y luego sus ventas mejoraron.- El negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación y lo abre a las 6 de la mañana y cierra a las 6 y media de la tarde.

Rosmeri, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos como frijol, arroz, pollo, pan, sodas y jugos, el crédito le ayudará para comprar más mercadería y hacer más rentable su negocio y mejor su calidad de vida.

Rosmeri, sueña con ayudar a sus hijos para que se preparen academicamente y que puedan tener una profesión y que tengan más oportunidades de encontrar un trabajo estable.
texts.en:
Rosmeri, 36 years old, studied until the 9th grade.  Due to the economic situation of her family, she could not continue her studies.  She is married and mother of three children, but only two are in school.  He husband works as a teacher in a school in the community where they live.

Rosmeri has five years of experience in the selling of basic home products.  She learned this job on her own.  Since she did not have a source of income, she decided to start her own business.  She began with few products and later her sales improved.  She has the business in her house, and she opens it at 6:00 in the morning and closes it at 6:30 in the afternoon.

Rosmeri is requesting this loan to buy products such as beans, rice, chicken, bread, sodas, and juices.  The loan will help her to buy more merchandise, to make her business more profitable, and to improve her quality of life.

Rosmeri dreams of helping her children so that they can prepare academically, that they can have a profession, and that they have more opportunities to find a stable job.

loans.use: To buy products such as beans, rice, chicken, bread, sodas, and juices.

loans.name: Estefa

texts.en:
Estefa is a resident in the rural town of Sagbayan, Bohol. Her means of livelihood is through raising and selling of hogs. She is married and has three children ages 13, 15 and 17 respectively. They are still attending school. Her husband's occupation is a laborer.

For the past 4 years in raising hogs. She needs to develop ways on how to become more sustainable. She has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed. In that way, she will be able to raise more pigs and has adequate supply of feed, that is very essential in her livelihood.

Estefa is determined that she will be productive in expanding her hog raising project to improve the family's living condition and to continue support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a carpentry where he makes furniture and has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more timber. His business goal is to open a big carpentry shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario con 52 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Sallique,provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Hilario cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción así como el comercio en general.

Hilario se dedica a la carpintería, cuenta con un taller propio ubicado en su propio domicilio, con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 15 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de pan llevar.Solicita préstamo para la compra de madera y de herramientas para mejorar su servicio. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Hilario es socio exclusivo para Edpyme Alternativa. Este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Hilario is 52 and lives with his life partner and son in the Sallique district of Jaén province, Cajamarca department, Perú. Hilario has very good personal and work references from local residents. People living in this area work primarily in agriculture and commerce. Rice is the biggest crop.

Hilario is a carpenter. He has his own workshop located at his own residence, and has more than fifteen years of experience in the business. He also works in agriculture growing basic food crops.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy wood and tools to improve his service. This way he will be able to bring in acceptable income to improve his quality of life.

Hilario is an exclusive member of Edpyme Alternativa. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools to improve his service.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel works hard to support her family. Jessel is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jessel requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell.

Jessel has been in this business for 2 years now.

Jessel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:

Judy has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Judy has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, spices, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future Judy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 43 years old, married with two children.

Ligaya works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Ligaya has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ligaya aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Consuelo

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Consuelo dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.name: Sara Lucia

texts.es: Sara tiene 21 años de edad,vive con sus hijos Rubí de 5 años y Josué de 3 años, es madre soltera el único medio de subsistencia es la compra y venta de muebles, ella se dedica a su negocio cerca de un año, solicita el crédito para la compra de mas mercadería así sus ingresos económicos aumentaran y podrá salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sara is 21 years old. She lives with her children, Rubí who is 5 and Josué who is 3. She is a single mother. Her only means of income is the purchase and sale of furniture. She has worked at her business for about a year.

She seeks a loan to buy more merchandise, so that her earnings will increase and she will be able to move forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell furniture.

loans.name: Hai Group

texts.en:
Seethon is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Seethon and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Seethon and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Seethon and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Seethon and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sokhei's Group

texts.en: Sokhei’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhei makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer tailor and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a married man. He has two children. He operates a retail business where he sells tires. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tires. He hopes that in the future he will be a successful businessman. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tires.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a farm where he grows maize,tomatoes and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Lily

Lily works hard to support her family. Lily is married and has a buy and sell accessories business in the Philippines.

Lily requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more accessories to sell to her customers.

Lily has been in this business for 5 years now.

Lily would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more accessories to sell to her customers

Lucia has been in this business for 6 years now.

loans.name: Erlinda

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell recycled materials for 23 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mercedes is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Mercedes has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like noodles, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

Mercedes has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like noodles, meat, vegetables, etc.  for her food production business

loans.name: Evelyn

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs.

Evelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Marina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, beans, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, beans, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gerlan

texts.en:
Gerlan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a services (manicure and pedicure) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for manicure and pedicure services for her services (manicure and pedicure) business.

Gerlan has been in this business for 14 years. Gerlan earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Margeolina

texts.en:
Margeolina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and os now requesting a new loan ti further build her business.

Margeolina dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Terersita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Teresita has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

Michelle has a selling ornamental plants business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Michelle has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Precilla works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Precilla is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts to resell.

Precilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 30 years now.

Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mziuri

texts.en:
Mziuri is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives in Batumi district with her family. Mziuri works at a local hotel as a cleaner and earns a small monthly salary.

She decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,500 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase a commercial space and will rent it out. She will earn a stable income and will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. Mziuri awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a commercial space in order to rent it out

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en:
Muhammed is a maize farmer from Damari village. As a Babban Gona member, Muhammed is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muhammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Muhammed will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Muhammed no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Muhammed hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 40 year old married woman with three children. Her husband represents the main income source for the family in order to fulfill their family needs and being always ready to meet always their demands. He works as a taxi driver and his income is barely sufficient.

That’s why, today, in order to pay her children study fees; she is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she will be able to help them and ensure them a suitable educational path.

loans.use: to pay her children study fees

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages and other items.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She considers CCT and lenders as God’s extensions of blessing since the loan amount of 20,000 PHP that she applied for was granted to her. She is very grateful that the amount helped her to buy additional products for her variety store, which continually increases its sales.

She’s working hard as she wants to invest for her own property someday, a house and lot to be specific. She decided to apply for another loan of 20,000 PHP to add grocery items to her variety store. The remainder will be used as a revolving fund for the day-to-day operations of the business.

On a weekly basis, Melanie regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience with her business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Flora

Flora is 58 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Flora has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Flora requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Flora has been in this business for 20 years. Flora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jean

Jean has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Joanne has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her rug weaving business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her bag making business

loans.name: Nelly

Nelly is 58 years old and married with two children. Nelly works very hard to provide for them.

Nelly has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.name: Ritchelle

texts.en:
Ritchelle is 37 years old, married with six children, four of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Ritchelle has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.es:
Martina, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudio hasta quinto grado debido a la pobreza de su familia no pudo continuar estudiando, estuvo acompañada y tuvo tres hijos, pero se separó y se hizo responsable de sus hijos ella sola y en su casa solo vive con sus hijos. 

Martina, se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, hot-dog, tortas, gaseosas y licuados de guineo, papaya, fresa, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 14 años y decidió dedicarse a este tipo de negocio desde que se separó de su esposo, antes de dedicarse a este negocio solo realizaba los quehaceres del hogar; ahora su lugar de trabajo está a cerca de su casa a 15 minutos a pie y su horario de trabajo es de 8:30 a.m. y termina a las 5:30 p.m. y en las temporadas de ferias en la ciudad donde vive, el horario de atención es más prolongado.

Martina, necesita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, jugos, sillas plásticas y mesas, para darle a sus clientes un mejor ambiente para degustar sus alimentos; ella espera que con estos cambios en su negocio, incremente la afluencia de clientes y con ello las ganancias porque sus ventas aumentaran. 

Martina, sueña con que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera universitaria y poder hacer más grande su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martina, at 49 years old, is an entrepreneurial woman. She went to school until the fifth grade. Due to her family's poverty, she couldn't continue studying. She was previously married, and has 3 children, but is separated now, and solely responsible for her children. She lives alone with her children.

Martina works selling hamburgers, hotdogs, sandwiches, sodas, and smoothies made from banana, papaya and strawberry. She's had this business for 14 years, and decided to work in this type of business when she separated from her husband. Before working in this business she just worked taking care of the home. Now her place of work is close to her home, 15 minutes by foot. Her schedule is from 8:30 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. In the festival seasons in the city she lives in, her work hours are longer.

Martina needs the loan to buy sodas, juices, and plastic chairs and tables, to give her customers a better environment in which to enjoy their food. She hopes that with these changes to her business, she will increase the influx of customers and increase her profits as her sales increase. Martina dreams that her children will be able to get a university degree, and that she will be able to make her home bigger.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, and plastic chairs and tables.

loans.name: Kirimya Vocational School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Prossy. She is the Administrator of Kirimya Vocational School, a mixed school in the urban area of Masaka with 650 students. Kirimya Vocational School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kirimya Vocational School will repay its loan from the school fees collected each term. Prossy ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando con 51 años de edad, de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia,junto a su esposa en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Armando cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Armando se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de chivos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos.De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio ,obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Armando is 51-years old. He is married and lives in his own home with his wife. They live in Zaña District, which is in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Department, Perú. Armando has been given very good personal as well as work references by the people of the area. The residents of this area make their livings primarily in agriculture, trade and raising livestock.

Armando makes his living raising and selling young goats. He has more than ten years of experience in this line of work. Armando is requesting the loan to purchase animals and feed for raising his animals. That will allow him to grow his business further, earn a greater income and improve his standard of living.

Armando is a new Edpyme Alternativa client.

loans.use: to purchase animals and feed for raising his animals.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. Loreta is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Loreta requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Loreta has been in this business for 3 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Loreta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a farming rootcrops business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Jean is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to  purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farming root crops business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Myrna is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut, meat, noodles, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut, meat, noodles, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 44 years old and widowed with two children. With two children in school, Emelda works very hard to provide for them.

Emelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Emelda has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Emelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and has eight children. Lolita is married and has two children who are still in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been in pig fattening for 14 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 52 years old, married with three children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Alicia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Alicia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Avita

texts.en:
Avita  is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Avita  is 35 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Avita  has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Avita  requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell.

Avita  has been in this business for 10 years. Avita  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Penouel Group

texts.fr: Sinawema est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Penouel», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 40  ans, mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais au marché central de la ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle va s’approvisionner en 130 poissons. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leur bébés.
texts.en:
Sinawema is a merchant and a member of the loan group “Penouel”. She is 40 years old and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. And she is a married mother of seven children, all in school. Sinawema has been selling fresh fish at the central market in town since she was young. She is going to stock up with 130 fish. She began her business with funds from her husband. Her wish is to build a house and provide schooling and food for her children.

So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs. We really wish to indicate that certain customers are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to stock up with 130 fish.

loans.name: Xenglaetha Group

texts.en: Mid’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Mid and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Mid and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Mid’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kasimu

texts.en:
Kasimu is a Babban Gona farmer. Kasimu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Kasimu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Kasimu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.


Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Kasimu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Kasimu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, bananas, etc. for her food production business.

Teresita has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, bananas, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Patricia Veronica

texts.es: Patricia Arévalo tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, Jefferson de 11 años, Johan de 8años, Jordán de 7 años y Melany de 5 años, se dedica a preparar y vender comidas rápidas, fuera de un colegio de su localidad, lo cual solicita el crédito para poder ayudar en los numerosos gastos que tiene su humilde familia.
texts.en: Patricia Arévalo is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and children, Jefferson aged 11, Johan, aged 8, Jordán aged 7,  and Melany, aged 5. She makes and sells fast food outside of a high school in her community. She is asking for the loan t help with the many expenses her humble family has.

loans.use: to outfit her fast food business.

loans.name: Pâquerette

texts.fr:
24 ans, Pâquerette est une jeune femme mariée et mère de deux petits enfants de 9 mois et de 4 ans. Ce dernier est scolarisé dans une école privée. Son époux est opérateur de saisi dans une entreprise spécialiste  en informatique. 
Elle exerce une activité de vente de poissons séchés depuis 2012, elle remarquait que c'est une activité pas encore pratiquée par les commerçants des environs. C'est pour ça qu'elle choisissait de le faire.Les prix de revient sont assez cher mais les marges bénéficiaires sont assez larges. Donc c'est très intéressant.
Son projet est de construire un petit pavillon en bois qui va lui servir de lieu de vente pour éviter le stockage au domicile et le va et vient fatiguant.
texts.en:
Pâquerette, aged 24, is a young married woman and the mother of two small children, aged 9 months and 4 months. The younger is in a private school. Pâquerette’s husband is a data-entry worker in an enterprise specializing in computers.

She has had a business selling dried fish since 2012. Having noticed this type of business is still practiced by nearby merchants, she therefore chose to do so. The costs are fairly high, but the profit margins are fairly large. So, it’s very worthwhile.

Her goal is to build a small wooden structure as a place for her sales, so as to avoid keeping an inventory at home and the weariness of going back and forth.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish

loans.name: Assumpter

texts.en: Assumpter is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as being ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, drinking water, flour, salt and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to build a business premise.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 48 years old and married with five children. Leah works very hard to provide for them.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, junk foods, biscuits, etc..

Leah has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Leah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, junk foods, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 43 years old and married with seven children. With five children currently in school, Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, sugar, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, salt, noodles, etc. to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, salt, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, sugar, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, salt, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Emma is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, chips, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, chips, etc.

loans.name: Mutiifu Group

texts.fr: Wema est commerçante, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Mutiifu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés et 1est petit. Elle est vendeuse de friperies au domicile dans une avenue de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter un ballon de friperies. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu d’un crédit. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Wema is a merchant and the treasurer of the loan group “Mutiifu”. She is 38 years old and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. And she is a married mother of three children, of whom two are in school, and one is very young.

Wema has been selling secondhand clothing on an avenue in town for five years. She began her business with capital from a loan. Her wish is to build a house and provide schooling and food for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase bale of used clothing

loans.name: Susana Yaneth

texts.es:
Susana, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad y junto a su pareja se levantan muy temprano para realizar las actividades diarias que se centran en la agricultura y el comercio de ropa.


Susana, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio se lo enseñaron sus padres y lo desempeña durante la mañana junto a su esposo y en la tarde vende ropa en los alrededores de su comunidad.

Susana, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para surtir su negocio, porque lo tiene bastante limitado y pierde clientes.

Susana, sueña con comprar un puesto en el mercado de la localidad, para establecer su negocio y no tener que andar fuera de su casa ofreciendo el producto.
texts.en:
Susana is 30-years old. She finished high school. Susana is married and has two children, who are 5-years and 1-year old respectively. Susana and her husband get up very early to start their daily chores, which center around agriculture and clothing sales.

Susana earns a living working in agriculture, a line of work she learned from her parents. She carries out that work in the morning alongside her husband. In the afternoon, Susana sells clothing in the outlying areas of her community.

Susana needs the loan to purchase clothing so she can stock up her business. Her business currently has pretty limited stock, which is causing her to lose customers.

Susana hopes to purchase a sales stall in the local market so she can establish her business and not have to go out and about to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to stock up her business.

loans.name: Grupo Las Paseyenebaj Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 32 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 4 y 11 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Antonia (se ubica en medio de las tres) para obtener mejores ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio lo realiza ella desde hace 6 años, ella es vendedora ambulante pues no cuenta con un puesto fijo donde vender. Pero también se dedica a la venta de almacigo de café. Antonia para mejorar su servicio y ofrecerle a sus clientes a decidió solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías  como: güipiles, fajas y cortes.
Su gran esperanza es tener un local donde poder exhibir mejor sus productos y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia is 32 year old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family of four children aged 4 to 11. They live in the community of Sololá.

In order to obtain more income and help her husband with the household expenses, Antonia (she is the one in the middle) buys and sells traditional clothing. She has had this business for 6 years. She is a street vendor and doesn't have a fixed spot where she sells. She also sells coffee seedlings. In order to improve her service and offer more to her customers, Antonia has decided to ask for a loan to buy more merchandise such as güipiles, sashes and fabrics.

Her biggest hope is to have a locale where she can better exhibit her products and keep strengthening her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing merchandise such as güipiles, sashes and fabrics.

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Mrs. Tan is 50 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in a small, old house. She has a stall for selling fruit and vegetables in the market. It is a good business and provides her with a good income. She requested a loan through QBWDF to buy a new collection of fruit and vegetables to sell at her stall. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to provide an education for her children.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of fruit and vegetables to sell at her stall

loans.name: Jouhayna

texts.en:
Jouhayna is a 32 year’s old married woman living with her husband and three children, still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to satisfy the family needs. And as for her, to supplement the family income, she works from home in selling homemade food to all her neighborhood.

Today, in order to pay her children’s educational fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them with the coming school year. Her only target is to see them pursuing his education suitably.

loans.use: to register her children at school for the coming school year.

loans.name: Ingrid Lissbeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 8 de Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ingrid, tiene 18 años de edad, está casada pero aun no  tienen hijos. Su esposo trabaja en el muelle de Manta
Doña Ingrid es una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza lo necesario para ganarse algo por su cuenta y así contribuir con los gastos que generan el hogar, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo, esto lo realiza puerta a puerta y en su casa, ella deja a crédito y lleva más de 3 años en este negocio con el cual se gana sus recursos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa y zapatos. Lleva dos ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es tener su casa propia para  cuando tenga sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 8 de Diciembre credit group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial history and for its hand made crafts, recognized nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous paja toquilla hats.

Here lives Ingrid. She is 18 and married, but she still has no children. Her husband works on the Manta pier.

Ingrid is a very hardworking woman who does what she needs to do to earn something on her own and contribute to the household expenses. For that she works as a merchant. She sells clothing and shoes via catalog. She does this door to door, selling on credit. She has had this business for more than 3 years and with it, she earns her income.

She is going to use this loan to buy clothes and shoes. She has been in the credit group for two cycles and she likes it because if the help of the loans. Her dream is to own her own home for when she has children.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Shelomith

texts.en:
Shelomith is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as being caring.

Shelomith operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She also runs a tailoring business. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Shelomith will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Fredesvinda con 65 años de edad, de estado civil viuda,vive en casa propia, junto a su nieta y sus 02 bisnietos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,país Perú. Fredesvinda cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Fredesvinda se dedica a la confección y costura de ropa para damas,niños,etc, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 20 años.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de tela para su negocio, ya que cuenta con pedidos y esto a la vez le generará mejores ingresos a su unidad familiar.

Fredesvinda si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, para Edpyme Alternativa es su sexto crédito.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda, 65, is a widow who lives in her own home with her granddaughter and her two great-grandchildren, in the district of Cayalti, Chiclayo province, Peru. Fredesvinda has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants of the area make a living mostly from agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Fredesvinda makes a living from the creation and sewing of clothing for women, children, etc. with 20 years of experience in this line of work. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of cloth for her business, since she has orders and this in turn will generate better income for her and her family unit.

Fredesvinda has experience with loans. With Edpyme Alternativa, it is her sixth loan.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cloth for her business since she has orders.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is blessed for knowing about Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and she’s thankful for the loan previously extended to her through the help of Kiva lenders. She was able to buy plastic wares/products for her buy and sell business. She can’t thank you enough for the monetary provision since this made her earn more each day.

Lydia is determined to succeed in the business so her children can finish their studies. With the help of the Lord, she and her family are able to survive on a day-to-day basis. However, Lydia still needs to have additional capital for her business. With this situation, she decided to apply for a loan of PHP 11,000 for her to buy additional plastic wares to sell as she wants to earn more for her family.

Lydia believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from the members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays Micro Finance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy more plastic products to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has been a consistent member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for many years now and she’s grateful that they quickly responded to her loan request. The amount that they approved let her buy medical merchandise for her mini drugstore. She wants to thank as well all of the lenders who provided financial support without asking for anything in return.

Norma wants to continuously support her family’s needs; that’s why she’s hardworking and determined to make the business grow. Her goal is to have the business expanded someday and offer variety of medicines as well. An approximate amount of PHP 50,000 is what she needs, and this is what she would like to borrow this time.

Norma regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience in her business, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and to listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional medicine products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

Analyn has been in this business for 6 years. Analyn earns more income from fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old and married with seven children. Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Alicia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a restaurant in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store business.

Virginia dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 39 years old and has eight children. Arlene is married and has five children who are in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic and other materials needed in her business.

Arlene has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and both children are enrolled in school.

Emy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emy requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emy would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane is 37 years old and married with seven children, five of whom in school, Baby Jane works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

Baby Jane has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Baby Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Barau

texts.en:
Barau is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Barau has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Barau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Barau can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Barau will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Barau is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps goats and pigs. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more goats.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa works hard to support her family. Diosa is married and has a nipa roofing making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Diosa has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Diosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ronelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling charcoal. Ronelyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to  purchase additional gallon of gasoline, bundle of fishing net, etc for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ronelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallon of gasoline, bundle of fishing net, etc

loans.name: Namdeua 2 Group

texts.en: Kaodee is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Kaodee and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Kaodee and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Kaodee and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Kaodee and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Martina Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 8 de Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Martina, tiene 40 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos  mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 15 años los mismos estudian en colegio y son los que aun viven en su casa.
Doña Martina es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante y así sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende en su casa aguas, colas, empanadas, corviches, jugos y batidos de frutas,  entre otras cosas que prepara, esto lo realiza de jueves a domingo que son los días que mejores ventas tiene, ya son más de 6 años que lleva dedicada a esta actividad y gracias a esto ella puede salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar plátano, carne, colas, aguas, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante.  Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Credit Group "8 de Diciembre" meets every two weeks in the Canton Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are recognized nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous hats of shawl straw.

In this place lives Martina, 40, who is separated, but from this union she has four children, two of majority age and two, 16 and 15, who study in the college and still live in her home.

Martina is a woman who has had to work very hard to get ahead and to bring her children along. She makes a living from commerce. She sells in her house refreshments, soft drinks, empanadas, corviches, juices, fruit smoothies, amongst other things she makes. This she does from Thursday to Sunday which are the days when she has her best sales. She has been doing this for more than six years and thanks to this she has been able to get ahead and bring her children along.

This loan she will use to buy bananas, meat, soft drinks, refreshments, fruit, and other foodstuffs for the preparation of meals. She has been with the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans let her get ahead. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, meat, soft drinks, refreshments, fruit, and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 46 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Analiza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Analiza has been in this business for three years. In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old, married with five children. One of whom is in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Helen has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Helen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming vegetables.

Edita dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Dina

texts.en:
Ma. Dina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a manufacturing (hollow blocks) business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy sand and gravel for her hollow blocks making.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising livestock.

Ma. Dina dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her  business.

loans.use: to buy sand and gravel for her hollow blocks making.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 57 years old and widow with nine children.  With two children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 48 years old, married with four children. Three of her children are enrolled in school, she is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Arlyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Arlyn has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Arlyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children. Five of her children are enrolled in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like noodles, canned good, sugar and other groceries.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like fattening pigs.

Lourdes dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like noodles, canned good, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Hap Group

texts.en: Xay’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Xay and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Xay and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Xay’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Josefa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Josefa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Josefa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Серьезный человек на фотке, Шерзод. Он серьезный, трудолюбивый и ответственный мужчина. Шерзоду 39 лет. Он отец четверых детей. Его дети еще маленькие. Жена домохозяйка и она ухаживает за детьми. Шерзод дехканин. У него есть свой бизнес. Он занимается животноводством. Шерзод во дворе имеет большой коровник, и имеет больше запас корм скота. Он выращивает крупнорогатого скота более 1 лет. Шерзод набрал себе больше опыта, и хочет продвигать деятельность на новый уровень. Он просит кредит для купли пару голов скота. Шерзод уверен в себе, и он всегда старается вперед. Он заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: The serious, hard-working and responsible man in this photo is Sherzod. He is 39 years old and has four young children. His wife is a homemaker and cares for the children. He is farmer with his own business raising livestock. His property includes a large barn where he keeps feed for the livestock . It's been over a year since he began raising cattle. Now that he has more experience he wants to take his business to a new level. He is asking for a loan to buy a pair of cows. Sherzod is sure of himself and is always looking ahead. He thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a pair of cows

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour ,salt and other items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, salt and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, bread, salt and other items

loans.name: Hien
