texts.en: Mrs. Hien is 53 years old. There are four  people in her family. Fishing is main income source of her family. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from selling fish, which her husband caught. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Ramón Isidoro

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 8 de Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive don Ramón, tiene 60 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes.
El señor Ramón es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante,  el es artesano y desde pequeño aprendió a elaborar muebles y adornos hechos con bejuco y ramas de árboles los mismos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes que gustan de productos tradicionales para sus hogares aunque la mayoría es para restaurantes y lugares turísticos, el realiza sus obras por pedidos que  sus clientes le realizan con anticipación, lleva más de 40 años dedicado a esta actividad la cual aprendió de su papá que se dedicaba a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pintura y otros materiales más para elaborar sus obras. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos él puede salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The "8 de Diciembre" communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Montecristi. The canton is known nationally and internationally for it's rich culture and it's handicrafts. It is the home of the famous straw hat.

Ramón lives here. He is 60 years old is married and from this relationship has three children who are adults and independent.

Ramón is a hard-working man who has always liked to work to get ahead. He is a craftsman and since he was young learned to make furniture and decorations made from reeds and tree branches. They are in high demand from his customers that like traditional products for their homes, although the majority are for restaurants and tourist places. He does his work by order that his clients make in advance. He has worked in this business for more than 40 years which he learned from his father who did this work.

This loan is to buy wood, paint and other materials to make his pieces. He has been in the communal bank since it's inception and he likes it as he can get ahead with the loans. His dream is to carry on and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint and other materials.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, a través de la cual quiere ganarse los medios para una vida digna.
Sus objetivos son la de culminar su carrera y poder emprender su propio negocio para poder ejercer su profesión y trabajar independientemente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Edith is from the city of Carapeguá. She is studying for a degree in business administration, through which she wants to gain the means for a decent life.
Her objectives are to finish her degree and be able to start her own business in order to practice her profession and work independently.
She asks for a loan to be able to pay the university fees, and in this way continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es estudiante de la Carrera de Química y Farmacia y está cursando actualmente el segundo curso. Ella vive en casa de sus padres y trabaja actualmente en una Constructora para poder solventar sus estudios, comenta que su meta es poder ejercer su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales universitarios que le serán de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Fatima is a chemistry and pharmacy student, and is currently in her second year of study. She lives at home with her parents and is currently working in construction to finance her schooling. She says that her goal is to be able to practice in her profession. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy her college materials, which will be of much help to be able to continue with her studies as she has been.

loans.use: to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace varios años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes con las ganancias con obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz por quintales y cal y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
This young woman's face has been pixelated because she is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has worked selling tortillas for many years from a store she runs in her home and she has many customers. With the income she makes she is able to cover some of the household bills.

This young woman lives in her own home with her life partner and her son. She is applying for a loan to buy corn by the quintal and limes so that she can generate a larger income.

loans.use: A loan of $750 helps this borrower to buy corn by the quintal and limes.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es de la ciudad de Pilar, está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir con sus anhelos de ser un profesional útil, no solo a sí mismo, sino también a los demás.
Él se esfuerza para poder cumplir con sus sueños de ser alguien en la vida y poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Edgar is from the city of Pilar. He is studying to be a systems analyst. He is working as hard as he can to be able to reach his aspirations to be a useful professional not only for himself, but also for others.

He is striving to fulfill his dreams to be someone in life, and to grow and succeed. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his schooling fees, and this way continue with his studies.

He is grateful for the opportunity that he receives to continue improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Tom & Jerry School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert. He is the head teacher of Tom & Jerry School, a mixed school in the urban area of Entebbe with 250 students. Tom & Jerry School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have consistent access to clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Tom & Jerry School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, a 47-year-old Palestinian, lives in a camp for refugees in north Lebanon. After growing up inside the camp, Ibrahim got married and now lives with his wife and their three children. While his wife does not work and his children go to school and university, Ibrahim owns a car repair shop. He is known to be extremely committed to his family and to his business. 

In fact, after working in a garage for more than 10 years, Ibrahim decided to open his own shop in 2007. His loyal customers see him as honest and trustworthy, which gives him a very good reputation in the area. For the first time Ibrahim is asking for a loan of 2,569,000 Lebanese pounds from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He is planning to use the loan to buy an air compressor which he will use in his shop. With this new equipment he will be able to cut some costs which is expected to increase his profits. 

With his children reaching university, Ibrahim is working hard to improve his business in order to cover tuition fees, as he sees his children's education as top priority in the upcoming years.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor for his car repair shop.

loans.name: Joab

texts.en:
Joab is a cattle keeper in Kajara Ntungamo, with the purpose of developing their family land into a farm and would like to buy young heifers, graze them for some time and resell them at a much higher price.

This activity will help them accumulate money to pay for his children's school fees. He is married with four kids who all go to school. He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Ugafode and requests Kiva funders and lenders to fund him.

Joab is pictured with his wife at the farm.

loans.use: to buy heifers for fattening.

loans.name: Edith Veronica

texts.es:
Edith, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, debido a la situación económica de su familia no pudo seguir estudiando, está casada y es madre de 1 hijo y su esposo trabaja como jornalero sembrando granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo. 

Edith, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años, ella aprendió este negocio gracias a su madre, porque ella empezó antes con esta actividad y Edith, decidió seguir trabajando vendiendo ropa, porque generaba buenos ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares; ella sale a vender ropa a diferentes cantones y la distancia que recorre es de tres kilómetros y a veces se transporta a pie y a veces en carro o bus, con ella sale a vender su madre y una de sus hermanas, trabajan tres días por semana.

Edith, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa como blusas, ropa interior y sandalias para damas, con el crédito podrá tener más mercadería para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos.

El sueño de Edith, es que su hijo se prepare academicamente y también quiere construir una vivienda más diga que le brinde mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Edith is 28 year old. She studied through high school, but because of her family's economic situation she could not continue her studies. She is married and is the mother of one son. Her husband is a day laborer, cultivating basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum.

For the past three years, Edith has sold clothing. She learned this business from her mother, who began the same business earlier. Edith decided to continue selling clothing because it has generated enough income to cover her family's expenses. She goes out to sell clothing in various parts of town. She goes about three kilometers each day, sometimes traveling by foot and sometimes by car or bus. Her mother goes out to sell with her, as does one of her sisters. They work three days each week.

Edith needs the loan to purchase clothing such as blouses, undergarments and women's sandals. With the loan she will be able to buy more merchandise and provide a better service to her customers. This will enable her to obtain greater profit.

Edith's dream is that her son is able to go through school, and also to construct a more dignified dwelling to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items.

loans.name: María Herlinda

texts.es: La Señora Herlinda tiene 59 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos adultos e independientes. Es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica que tiene entre sus sueños y esperanzas para el futuro incrementar la producción orgánica de sus cultivos. Con 40 años de experiencia como agricultora utilizará el préstamo para la compra de abonos orgánicos para incrementar la producción de sus cultivos (papa, maíz y tara) y poder obtener mayores ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 59 years old, married and has five children who are all independent adults. She is an enterprising and dynamic woman whose hopes and dreams for the future include increasing production of her organic crops.

With her 40 years of experience as a farmer Herlinda will use this loan to buy organic fertiliser to increase production of her crops (potatoes, corn and tara) so as to obtain a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertiliser for her crops

loans.name: Asida

texts.en:
Asida is a 36-year-old mother of two daughters and one son. All of them are school-aged and the family get the persecution pension, which is the only source of income for them. Asida and her children live in poverty, as they have no significant income to tackle financial difficulties. She was unable to find a stable job. Asida has now decided to make her own business and start clothes trading. 

All of the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Asida applied for credit with MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. She plans to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then sell them in her community with price mark-ups. 

Asida and her children rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very grateful, as their living condition will somehow become better.

loans.use: to purchase clothing stock and start a trading business.

loans.name: Nile Citizen School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is George. He is the director of Nile Citizen School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kalisizo with 400 students.

Nile Citizen School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Nile Citizen School will repay its loan from its school fees, which they collect each term. George ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena con 43 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus 05 hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú,en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y al comercio.

Elena se dedica a brindar los servicios agrícolas de jornalería, así mismo cuenta con su motocarguera roja la cual le sirve como medio de transporte para trasladar sus herramientas de trabajo; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio.Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento de motocarguera y para arreglos de vivienda, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Elena es socio recurrente para Epyme Alternativa. Ha tenido un crédito de S/.3000,00 el cuál a sido cancelado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de nosotros su negocio ha mejorado y su calidad de vida de igual forma.
texts.en:
Elena is 43 years old, in a de facto relationship and lives with her partner and her five children in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, located in the Chiclayo province of Lambayeque, Peru. The inhabitants of this area mainly work in farming and business.

Elena works as a farmhand and for this she has a red motor-cart which she uses as a method of transport to move her tools of the trade. She has spent more than 10 years in this line of work.

Elena is applying for a loan to service her motor-cart and do home repairs. This loan will help her to obtain equipment and tools in better condition which will have a great impact on her business. By doing this she hopes to improve her productivity and better attend to the diverse needs of her customers in the area.

Elena is a frequent lender with Edpyme Alternativa. She has previously taken out a loan of S/.3000,00 which she paid off on time. Since she has become a member with them her business has improved and so has her quality of life.

loans.use: to service her motor-cart and to do home repairs

loans.name: Mara Scherezada

texts.en:
Scherezada is a 25-year-old woman. She is single and lives with her parents. Although she is looking forward to being independent and living on her own, she doesn't want leave her parents' house just yet. She doesn't want to leave her parents on their own. She currently is taking care of both of them, and she also provides a very considerable income to her house.

Scherezada is a hardworking person, and she is happy at her work, but she doesn't want to be an employee forever. She has promising, long-term goals; one of these is owning her own business. She sees a fine chance to develop her business in the catalogue selling of shoes.

She wants to start now with something small that grows through time, and later, she wants to retire and make a living out of it. In order to address this goal, now she is applying for a 5,264 MXN loan from Kiva through Kubo.financiero, a Mexican field partner.

According to people interviewed by Kubo, Scherezada is a highly reliable person who is honest and always pays her debts.

loans.use: to start a shoe selling business of her own.

loans.name: Monday Sam

texts.en:
Monday Sam hails from Ruhaama Ntungamo. He is a businessman dealing in the local brew called waragi. He produces some and even buys from other locals who produce it. His market is in Kabale and Kampala towns. He has five kids and one dependent whom he provides for. He applied for 3,000,000 UGX to help him fund his activities since he is assured of a ready market, the brand being affordable.

He is requesting support from Kiva funders.

loans.use: to buy more stock of the local brew

loans.name: Uganda Martyrs Buyoga School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Noah. He is the administrator of Uganda Martyrs Buyoga School, a mixed school in the urban area of Masaka with 300 students.

Uganda Martyrs Buyoga School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Uganda Martyrs Buyoga School will repay its loan from its school fees, which they collect each term. Noah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Alhaji Jafaru

texts.en:
Alhaji Jafaru is a maize farmer from Damari village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Jafaru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Jafaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Alhaji Jafaru will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji Jafaru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Alhaji Jafaru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: St. Joseph Tech. Kiteredde School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Joseph. He is the principal of St. Joseph’s Tech Kiterede School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kyotera in Masaka with 400 students. St. Joseph’s Tech Kiterede School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Joseph’s Tech Kiterede School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Joseph ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Amuria High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Samson. He is the head teacher of Amuria High School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Amuria with 800 students. Amuria High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Amuria High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Samson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi, a 25-year-old married man, lives in the village of Ananuri. He has a wife, who is temporarily unemployed and a mother, the only employed person in the family. She works as a cleaner and gets 450 GEL monthly. Because of his secondary education and high unemployment rate in the region, Giorgi has been unable to start a stable job so he wants to make his own source of income and private activity. 

According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. Giorgi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but without any success. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. Giorgi has been approved for a loan of 4,000 GEL, which he plans to use for purchasing a secondhand car and to start providing taxi services. He will be the driver and will serve the local people and get a daily income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and Giorgi will be able to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start providing taxi services.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rima is 24 years old and has one child in school.

Rima has a fishing  business in the Philippines. Rima requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Rima has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Rima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 51 years old, married with seven children. Two of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Salvacion has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Salvacion has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fertilized duck egg maker business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of duck egg to make fertilized duck egg for her fertilized duck egg maker business.

Cecelia has been in this business for 18 years. Cecelia earns more income from general store, pig fattening and buy and sell dressed chicken.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of duck egg to make fertilized duck egg

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 60 years old, married with five children.

Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, home product care, and other groceries.

Wilma has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from sewing.

Wilma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, soap, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

Nenita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 30 years old and single with one children. Arlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Arlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

Arlyn has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Arlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ginalyn is 39 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ginalyn has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Ginalyn requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables like cabbage, carrots, onions, garlic, eggs and etc to sell to her local market.

Ginalyn has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like cabbage, carrots, onions, garlic, eggs and etc to sell to her local market

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 29 years old and both of her children are enrolled in school.

Marivic has a general store business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ahmad has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ahmad would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ahmad can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ahmad will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Ahmad is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nurhaya

texts.en:
Sari-sari store business in the Philippines is rampant. At the comfort of your own home you can manage your own store. Filipinos prefer to buy items in a Sari-sari store since most are just located in neighborhoods, Barangays and barrios without spending fair going to cities just to buy items. Sari-sari is a Filipino word which means “variant” where items are cheaper since products are purchase on wholesale but being sold by piece, kilos or by volume to consumers. Candies, biscuits, seasonings, can goods and such are being sold by piece. Peanut butter, mayonnaise and other spreads are being sold by volume while rice and animal feeds are measured by kilos.

Nurhaya is one of the members of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), a housewife and a Sari-sari store owner. She enjoys managing the store since she can take care of her family while doing the business. Indeed, this became a medium for her in supporting her family’s needs. However, not all the time she earns enough profit. She still needs capital to buy additional products so that her store will offer complete products to customers.

She applied for a loan amount of P15, 000 that will be used as an added capital since she aims to expand the business and continually be able to support her children’s education. The amount will be used to buy grocery products like can goods, sugar, oil, bottled drinks and other grocery items.

On a weekly basis, Nurhaya regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To expand the business by adding grocery products.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta is single with one child and has a buy and sell peanut butter business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to but more bottle of peanut butter to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottle of peanut butter to sell.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luna is 45 years old and has one child still in school.

Luna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Luna requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, meat, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business.

Luna has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guilerma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell bananas.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Guilerma dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en: Mrs. Thuong  is a hardworking woman, 50 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without hygienic latrine. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and cultivation. With more than 20 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Sani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Sani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Sani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Sani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a single woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melanie is 47 years old and has one child still in school.

Melanie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Melanie has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to biuld and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 68 years old, married with 3 adult age children. He is known in Calamba area as a skilled carpenter. Through this, he was able to feed his family and raised them well until they finished their studies.

Recently, he asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for the placement fee on working abroad. He wants to seek greener pasture for the education of his children and to build a decent house for them.

loans.use: to pay for the placement fee on working abroad

loans.name: Liziel

texts.en:
Liziel, 33, is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She and her partner have 3 school-age kids. She joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates their programs and services. From her desire to help the family, she is engaged in selling fish in different barangays in municipality of Sindangan. She has been doing this for 7 years.

In need of additional working capital, she requested a financial assistance from Paglaum MPC an amount of Php 5,000.00 to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this, she hopes to increase and/or has more income for she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family and also she is happy she can support the education of her children which is her main priority of her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra operates a motor transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community of Sindangan. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts/repair

loans.name: Jenife

texts.en:
Jenife is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for 2 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP. Jenife is 24 years old, married and has 1 infant. She is from the village of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. In 2014, Jenife joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Jenife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Jenife is requesting her 2nd loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Eston

texts.en: Eston is a married man. He has 2 children. He is a mason. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy construction equipment. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy construction equipment

loans.name: Jeenifer

texts.en:
Jennifer finds retailing business very easy. She retails fuel/firewood in the locality of Sindangan. She sought financial assistance from Paglaum MPC and made a good turn out from her initial capital.

She has a meager income of Php 500 per week that has make their ends meet. Recently, she applied a loan to restock/firewood for retail. She wants to take advantage of having enough inventories that bring in higher income.

loans.use: to restock fuel/firewood for retail

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 41 years old and she lives with her daughter and mother in a cute house in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Karine is divorced and she does her best to cover her family’s needs. Her daughter is school-aged. Karine works as a secretary.

Since being the only bread winner Karine works very hard and their number of financial needs she hardly manages to solve with her small salary. This loan now Karine asks as she decided to do some repairs on her house, since in winter period it very cold there and the walls of it are very thin. She hopes so much that with this Kiva loan of 100.000 Armenian drams she will manage to make the walls of her house thicker, so that during the winter the warmth of the house will remain inside unlike the past years.

loans.use: to make thicker the walls of her house so that during the winter the warmth of the house will remain inside unlike the past years

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo, de 54 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a sus padres, estudio hasta noveno grado, su familia esta con formada por su esposa, quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos y sus hijos que le ayudan en sus actividades diarias.

Eduardo, se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para irse a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcelas que alquila y durante el resto del día se dedica a trabajar como motorista, realizando viajes fuera de su lugar de residencia y este trabajo lo realiza desde hace varios años.

Eduardo, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras, porque desea empezar a producir leche para que su esposa elabore lácteos para vender.

Eduardo, sueña con comprar más vacas y ampliar el negocio de comercio de lácteos.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 54 years old, works in agriculture. He has learned this practice thanks to his parents. He studied until 9th grade. His family consists of his wife, who helps him with domestic work, and his children, who helps him with other daily activities.

Eduardo wakes up at 5:30 am to go work in the borrowed lands for the morning. For the rest of the day, he works as a driver travelling in and out of his area of residence, in which he has been working for many years.

Eduardo needs the loan to buy two milking cows. He wishes to begin producing milk so that his wife can sell dairy products. Eduardo's dream is to buy more cows and to grow the dairy product business.

loans.use: to buy two milking cows

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: Mariana tiene 46 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija Josselin de 11 años de edad, hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos, esta es su única actividad económica y solicita el crédito para la compra de mas crías , así podrá venderlas y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mariana is 46 years old, and lives with her husband and her eleven-year-old daughter Josselin. She has been working in the breeding and sales of pigs for 10 years. This work is her only economic activity.

She is requesting the loan to buy more animals to raise. This way she will be able to sell them and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rosa, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado y es madre soltera, se levanta temprano para vender en su pequeña tienda y para trabajar en la agricultura.

Rosa, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura durante la mañana, mientras su madre vende en la tienda y en el transcurso de la tarde ella se encarga de la tienda. 

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para surtir la tienda con productos como arroz, azúcar, café, pan, detergentes, bebidas, entre otros, porque no tiene varios de esos productos y sus clientes piden ese tipo de productos.

Rosa, sueña con construir una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25-years old. She went to school until the 9th grade and is a single mother. She gets up early to sell in her small store and to work in agriculture. Rosa works in agriculture during the morning while her mother sells in the store and during the afternoon she takes care of the store.

Rosa needs the loan to supply the store with products such as rice, sugar, coffee, bread, detergents, drinks, and others, because she does not have a lot of those products and her customers ask for those types of products. Rosa dreams of building a respectable house for her family.

loans.use: to supply the store with products such as rice, sugar, coffee, bread, detergents, drinks, and others.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong is 41 years old, married and has two children. She works hard to support her family. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Husbandry and cultivation are the main income of her family and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hoga, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de materiales de contruccion y asi poder tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en: Luis is 39-years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has owned a store located in his home for 10 years and with what he gets from his sales, he manages to resolve some household expenses. He wants to improve his house, by re-plastering the walls, but with the earnings from his sales he does not have enough to do that. For that reason, he is asking for a loan to buy construction materials and thus he can have a better home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Yohana Alexander

texts.es:
Yohana, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera, se levanta temprano para realizar las actividades comerciales que es la elaboración de comida típica y también para trabajar en la agricultura.

Yohana, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, porque ese oficio se lo enseñaron sus padres, esta actividad la realiza durante la mañana y en la tarde elabora comida típica para vender en los alrededores de su comunidad.  

Yohana, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla, para que en el futuro le ayude a producir leche, para empezar un negocio de lácteos.

Yohana, sueña con comprar más vacas lecheras para incrementar la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Yohana, 20 years old and single, studied up to secondary school. She wakes up early to work in the commercial activities of agriculture and food preparation.

Yohana works in agriculture, an activity that her parents taught her. She works in this activity in the mornings, and in the afternoons she prepares typical food and sells in the surrounding areas of her community.

Yohana needs the loan to buy a heifer, which in the future can help her produce milk and start a diary products business. Yohana's dream is to buy more milking cows to increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Francisco Orlando

texts.es:
Francisco con 50 años de edad,de estado civil separado, vive sólo en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Francisco cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Francisco se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años.Solicita préstamo para arreglo de las habitaciones que alquila, pintura para pintar las habitaciones, lo cuál le dará una mejor presentación a su negocio.

Francisco es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, se encuentra bancarizado.
texts.en:
Francisco, 50 years old and separated, lives alone in the Pucará district in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region in Peru. Francisco has very good references in the area, both personal and professional. The people who live in this area mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Francisco works by renting out rooms. He has ten years of experience in this profession. He is applying for a loan to fix up and paint the rooms that he rents, which will create a better image for his business.

Francisco is a new, banked member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to fix up and paint the rooms that he rents.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will buy another farm. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jose Donald

texts.es: Donald una persona muy alegre divertida de 42 años de edad padre de 7 hijos 3 varones Erik, Kevin, Maiquel y 4 mujeres Michel, Lizbeth , Karen y  Dondelayarin ,  todos estudian,  el vive con sus hijos, esposa y sobrina Rosario a quien también da educación y alimentación ,  desde  muy  niño aprendió de su tío, sobre la elaboración de cocadas, hoy en día se dedica también a la elaboración y venta de este producto en los  buces  , Donald abandona su familia semana a semana recorriendo el país para poder vender sus cocadas, Es de este manera que él puede obtener ingresos para poder mantener a la familia y dar estudio a sus hijos y sobrina . Con el  crédito comprara  implementos para la elaboración de cocadas, esto  aumentara sus ventas y  mejorara su situación económica,  permitiendo que sus hijos sigan estudiando y no tengan que abandonar la escuela para ir a trabajar con él.
texts.en:
Donald is a very happy, fun, 42-year old father of 7 children: 3 sons, Erik, Kevin, and Maiquel, and 4 daughters, Michel, Lizbeth, Karen and Dondelayarin. All of them are students. He lives with his children, wife, and niece, Rosario, to whom he also provides education and food.

From an early age he learned from his uncle about coconut confections making. Nowadays he makes a living in the preparation and sale of this product, as well in buses. Donald leaves his family week after week touring the country to be able to sell his coconut confections. It is in this way that he is able to earn income to support his family and to provide education to his children and niece.

With the loan he will purchase implements for preparing coconut confections. This will augment his sales and will improve his economic situation, allowing his children to continue studying and not have to leave school to go to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase implements for making coconut confections.

loans.name: Amanda Gabriela

texts.es: Amanda, tiene 20 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hijo Luis de 3 años, hace dos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos, solicita el crédito para comprar mas crías y así poder extender su negocio el cual le proporciona las ganancias necesarias para la subsistencia de ella y de su hijo.
texts.en: Amanda is 20-years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 3-year old son, Luis. Two years ago she started working raising and selling pigs. She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to be able to extend her business, which will provide her the necessary earnings for her and her son's survival.

loans.use: to increase pigs for her business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La Sra. Maxima es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, se esfuerza siempre para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de su trabajo, tiene un autoservice muy completo con el cual tiene los ingresos para poder ofrecer a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso para poder surtir su negocio con productos variados, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de Cervezas,lácteos, panificados, golosinas y embutidos, y otros productos para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maxima is a very hard-working person and a fighter. She always strives to be able to improve her living conditions through her work. She has a very complete auto service with which she has the income to be able to offer her loved ones all that she could not have.

She says that her previous loan was used to be able to supply her business with various products, which was a big help to her. She is asking for a new loan to be able to invest into buying beer, dairy products, baked goods, candy, sausages and other products to be able to keep going with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy beer, dairy products, baked goods, candy, sausages and other products.

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es:
Sandra, de 24 años de edad, es una joven luchadora y emprendedora, está soltera, no tiene hijos, vive con sus tres hermanos y su madre, ella es la mayor de todos y es ella quien trabaja para sacar adelante a su familia. 

Sandra, se dedica a trabajar como empleada en un supermercado, ella trabaja en el turno de la mañana y tarde, ella comenzó a trabajar desde que era pequeña, cuando ayudaba a su madre a vender flores elaboradas a base de bolsas plásticas, ella asegura que gracias ello ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. 

Sandra, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar flores de bolsa junto a su madre, porque se acerca el día de los santos difuntos y se venden mucho ese día,  este será un ingreso extra para los gastos de fin de año y para cubrir muchas cosas.  

Sandra, sueña con colocar una tienda de flores artificiales, para tener su propio negocio y además planea inscribirse en la universidad y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Sandra is 24-years old. She is a young fighter and entrepreneur. She is single and does not have any children. She lives with her three siblings and her mother. She is the oldest of them and the one who works to support her family. Sandra works as a supermarket employee. She works the morning and afternoon shifts. She started working when she was young, when she helped her mother to sell flowers made from plastic bags. She says that thanks to this she has been able to support her family.

Sandra needs the loan to buy materials to make plastic bag flowers with her mother because All Saints Day is coming up and they sell a lot on this day. This will be an extra income for the end-of-the-year expenses and to cover many things. Sandra dreams of setting up her own artificial flower store to have her own business, and she also plans to enroll in college and be a professional.

loans.use: to buy materials for making plastic bag flowers.

loans.name: Esteban Roberto

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Esteban un joven de 25 años, habita en casa de familiares junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 9 meses. 
Esteban es un joven emprendedor, hace más de un año él se ha dedicado a brindar el servicio de catering en eventos de la ciudad, le ayuda mucho su esposa, juntos han trabajo duro para salir adelante y ser reconocidos como buenos microempresarios. 
Hace tres meses Esteban decidió emprender en otro negocio, quiso aprovechar sus habilidades en la cocina y también porque su domicilio se encuentra en un sitio muy adecuado; inició con una cafetería donde vende sanduches, postres, café y varios, justamente se encuentra frente a un complejo donde hay piscinas y en las tardes es muy concurrido.
Gracias a sus ganancias del negocio de catering pudo adecuar el local, compró mesas, sillas, cafeteras y demás,  pero ahora con este crédito que Fundación Alternativa y el proyecto Kiva ha podido otorgarle Esteban podrá terminar de adecuar para brindar un mejor servicio y fortalecer el negocio, comprará más cafeteras, una mesa inoxidable para preparar los bocaditos y más mesas y sillas. Se siente agradecido porque ninguna institución ha podido brindarle apoyo en un emprendimiento, está feliz porque podrá seguir creciendo como microempresario.
texts.en:
Esteban lives in the city of Santo Domingo. He is 25 years old and lives in a relative's house with his wife and his little 9 month old son.

Esteban is a young entrepreneur. For more than a year, he has offered catering service for events in his city. . His wife helps him a lot and together they have worked hard to get ahead and be recognized as good micro-business people.

There months ago, Esteban decided to open another business. He wanted to take advantage of his cooking abilities. in addition, his residence is in a very good spot. He started with a cafe where he sells sandwiches, desserts, coffee and more. He is in front of a swimming pool complex and in the afternoons there are a lot of people.

Thanks to the profits from the catering business, he was able to set up the locale. He bought tables, chairs, coffee machines. and more. But now, with this loan from the Fundación Alternativa and the Kiva project, Esteban will be able to outfit his locale to offer a better service and strengthen the business. He will buy more coffee machines, a stainless steel table to prepare snacks, and more tables and chairs. He feels grateful because no other institution has been able to support him in an enterprise. He is happy because he will be able to keep growing as a micro-businessman.

loans.use: to open her own cafe. This will allow her to give him family a better quality of life and for him to grow as a micro-businessman.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela, de 44 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y simpática, vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos, porque los dos mayores están casados y viven con sus respectivas familias. 

Angela, tiene una pupuseria que está ubicada en el mercado municipal, ella vende toda clase de pupusas y sus clientes aseguran que son deliciosas y que les gusta comer ahí por la atención y el buen servicio, pues tiene más de 15 años de tener este negocio.

Angela, necesita el préstamo para comprar mobiliario para su negocio, específicamente sillas y mesas y para comprar maíz y frijol para reducir sus costos. 

Angela, sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y que tengan una vida llena de oportunidades.
texts.en:
Angela is 44 years old. She is a very hardworking and kind person. She lives with her husband and two of their children, because the two oldest are married and live with their respective families.

Angela has a pupusa business which is located in the city market. She sells all types of pupusas and her customers assure her that they are delicious and that they like to eat there because of the attention service and good service. She has had this business for more than 15 years.

Angela needs the loan to buy furniture for her business, specifically tables and chairs, as well as to buy corn and beans to reduce costs.

Angela dreams of seeing her children become college graduates and to have lives full of opportunities.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her business, specifically chairs and tables, and to buy corn and beans to reduce costs.

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola tiene 50 años de edad vive con su esposo y una hija, Viviana de 11 años, Fabiola hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos, es un trabajo que se dedica de esfuerzo y mucha constancia pues así obtiene buenos resultados en las crías e incrementa su valor, solicita el crédito para comprar más ejemplares así incrementara  su economía y la de su familia.
texts.en: Fabiola is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and a daughter, Viviana, who is 11. For ten years, Fabiola has worked raising and selling pigs. It is a job that requires hard work and a lot of stability to get good results from the piglets to increase their value. She is asking for the loan to buy more pigs to increase her and her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy and sell pigs.

loans.name: Solofoniaina Marie Dorothé

texts.fr:
Marie Dorothée est mariée et a 27 ans. Son mari travaille comme machiniste dans une société de production d’emballages. Le couple a deux enfants (5 ans et 1 an) dont l’ainé est  scolarisé dans une école privée.
Elle dispose de 6 années d’expérience dans l’activité d’engraissement porcin. Le suivi technique de l’élevage est assuré par un vétérinaire. C’est une activité héritée de ses parents. Elle est actuellement à son troisième prêt, tous les prêts obtenus ont servi à financer la même activité. Les bénéfices tirés des exercices antérieurs lui ont permis de produire des briques et d’acheter des matériaux pour la construction de sa maison. 
Elle n’hésite pas à saisir les opportunités quand il s’agit d’activités pouvant générer des revenus. Elle travaille aussi comme secrétaire dans une école privée catholique. Il y avait des moments où elle assurait des cours. Elle a déjà suivi une formation bureautique après l’obtention du baccalauréat. L’objectif du ménage est de pouvoir construire une maison car la famille vit actuellement dans une maison appartenant aux parents.
texts.en: Marie Dorothée is married and is 27 years old. Her husband works as an operator in a packaging production company. The couple have two children (5 years and 1 year), the oldest of whom goes to a private school. She has 6 years experience in the pig fattening business. The technical monitoring of the farming is carried out by a veterinarian. It's a business inherited from her parents. She is currently on her third loan, all of the loans obtained have been used to finance the same business. The profits derived from earlier financial years have allowed her to make bricks and to buy materials for the construction of her home. She does not hesitate to seize opportunities when it comes to business that could generate income. She works also as a secretary in a private catholic school. There were times where she was providing classes. She has already taken an office training after obtaining her baccalaureat. The objective of the couple is to be able to build a home, as the family currently lives in a house belonging to the parents.

loans.use: to buy 3 pig's heads and feed

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector is the owner and operator of Metro Talent Group Inc. He is an actor and musician who began his career over 20 years ago. He has worked with many famous Salsa musicians and even had a long-running stint on Law and Order. One of his greatest achievements was working as a music consultant and actor in the movie "El Cantante," which focused on the life of famous Salsa musician, Hector Lavoe.

Hector is working on putting out a Latin American music album and needs to secure financing to complete it. "It will be divided into a two-volume series and then distributed globally," explains Hector.

Help this talented musician share his sounds with the world!

loans.use: to complete his new music album.

loans.name: Clorese

texts.en:
Clorese owns an asphalt paving business. She is originaly from Newark, NJ and was raised in Boca Raton, Florida. She lives at home with her 15-year-old daughter. Through owning her own business, Clorese has been able to regain her financial stability. Through her business she has successfully been able to employ family members to support and contribute to her company's growth.

She is currently seeking a loan to purchase an asphalt roller and trailing. Doing so will allow her to work more effectively and efficiently in completing projects. Her vision for the future is to become a more self-sufficient business. She hopes to no longer need to rely on rentals to secure her company's success.

loans.use: to purchase an asphalt roller and trailer.

loans.name: Brittany

texts.en:
Brittany is originally from South Carolina. She has a degree in education and knows how to play the piano. After she graduated college she had difficulty finding work. As a result she decided to combine her talent and educational background to start her business, More Than Music.

Through More Than Music Brittany is able help students with learning disabilities improve academically through learning a new instrument.

Her greatest success so far has been having the opportunity to see her students progress so quickly academically soon after working with her. Brittany is motivated by the impact learning a new instrument can have on a struggling student's behavior, academics and outlook.

Brittany is currently seeking a loan to purchase keyboards, update her computer software and website. Making the mentioned purchases will help Brittany to be better equipped and allow her to take on more students in group classes. Her vision for the future is to grow her business sustainably and to build a strong brand in her community.

loans.use: to purchse additional keyboards and to update her software and website.

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en: Upon getting married, Annelyn, of San Miguel, Bohol embraced the livelihood that her husband has been into – rice farming. She is 27 years old with three young kids aged 1, 4 and 7. It has been six years since she joined farming. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Annelyn is inspired to make her business successful so that her three children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Amabelle

texts.en:
Amabelle works hard to support her family. Amabelle is married and has a buy and sell frozen food business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like ham, bacon, hot-dog, etc. to sell.

Amabelle has been in this business for 3 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like ham, bacon, hotdog, etc. to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
From t-shirts, to business cards Michael spends his days developing designs to improve the marketing quality of many organizations across Alabama. He has owned Blu Designs Service, LLC for nearly three years. During this time, Michael invested in the start-up expenses, office space, and the tools needed to craft his specialty designs.

“I love my business and even more so I really love designing,” said Michael. “Whether it’s a building sign or designing a t-shirt, it is so rewarding to see something I have made out in my community.”

Michael’s growing business needs additional equipment to approve his work flow and increase design output. With his loan, he plans to hire additional employees to support the day-to-day operations of Blu Designs Service, LLC, building a creative design team for his establishment.

“I’ve managed to start this business, surviving on referrals,” said Michael. “I have a healthy client base, so hiring creative employees could take Blu Designs to the next level.”

loans.use: to hire new employees and purchase equipment.

loans.name: Niña Fe

texts.en:
Niña Fe lives in a village surrounded by coconut trees. She is from Valencia, Bohol. In this place people also thrive due to their coconut farming business. Some of the people are farming coconut for copra production and coconut wine.

Niña Fe's business is being a copra dealer and a rice farmer. She is happy because through this means, she can help her husband who is driving their motorcycle for an income. He transports passengers using his vehicle.

Niña Fe will use her income to buy her three young children healthy meals and pay for their school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel and spare tires.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business. Analiza has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anawen

texts.en:
Anawen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening.

Anawen dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Betty Lou

texts.en:
Betty Lou is 42 years old, mariied and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fatening, in the Philippines. Betty Lou requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. Betty Lou has been pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Betty Lou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like vinegar, spices, noodles, etc.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like vinegar, spices, noodles.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee to sell.

loans.name: Eavngeline

texts.en:
Eavngeline is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her rice retailing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Eavngeline dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
El Sr. Modesto es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, es carpintero hace más de 30 años, empezó siendo secretario de un carpintero recorrió varias carpintería y de apoco comenzó a comprar herramientas y se lanzó a trabajar de manera independiente y  hoy ya tiene clientela formada, su taller lo tiene en su casa y ahora habilito una pequeña almacén y le va muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas variadas para poder surtir su despensa, y de esa forma poder seguir dando a sus clientes una buena variedad a la que están acostumbrados. Es una persona muy luchadora que se esfuerza para poder seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos con su negocio.
texts.en:
Modesto is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso and has been a carpenter for more than 30 years. He started as secretary to a carpenter, covering several carpenter's workshops, and soon began buying tools and started working independently. He now has an established customer base, his workshop is in his house and he has now set up a small grocery store. Things are going very well for him.

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy various types of drink to stock his store with and thus be able to continue providing his customers with the variety they are used to. He is a very determined person who is making every effort to be able to continue supporting his loved ones with his business.

loans.use: to buy various types of drink to stock his store with.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora y muy amigable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizado por acoger la mayor parte de la población y por la producción manufacturera, de clima cálido y húmedo.
Josefa es morena de baja estatura y cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes como; fideo, arroz, harina, maíz, trigo, condimentos, enlatados y conservas, “mi negocio funciona todo el día y toda la semana, mis clientes siempre encuentran abierto el local…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que está abierto durante largas jornadas, la desventaja es la falta mercadería variada para surtir y abastecer el negocio. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia, ella desea abastecer su tienda comprando abarrotes y alimentos de primera necesidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Josefa solicita un préstamo para comprar abarrotes y alimentos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Josefa is a 38-year-old woman, she lives with her partner without children, and her business is grocery sales.

She is independent, enterprising and very friendly. Her business is located in the zone south of the city, characterized as having the largest part of the population and for producing manufactured goods, with a warm and humid climate.

Josefa has a dark complexion, is short, and has long black hair. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her partner who works as a driver. They live in a room that belongs to family, built of brick which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is the sale of groceries such as noodles, rice, flour, corn, wheat, seasonings, and canned and preserved goods. "My business is open all day and all week, my customers always find the store open..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it is open for long hours, the disadvantage is the lack of a variety of merchandise to stock the business. Her dream is to have her own store. She wants to stock her store purchasing groceries and basic foods. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that she has done this work.

For these reasons, Josefa asks for a loan to purchase groceries and basic food to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and basic food to stock her store.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio está casado con la Sra. Modesta, ambos tienen 3 hijos todos ya mayores e independientes que por medio de su arduo trabajo pudieron sacar adelante. Poseen en su casa una despensa y también el Sr. Julio se dedica al rubro de fletes, son una pareja muy trabajadora que pese a los problemas ha podido salir adelante.
El Sr. Julio continua esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y la de su esposa, es por ello se sigue esforzándose y trabaja mucho. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos variados para su despensa, como ser bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros, y de esa manera seguir ofreciendo una buena calidad a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Julio is married to Modesta, they have 3 children, all of whom are adults and independent who, through their hard work, they were able to get ahead.
