They have a store in their house, and Julio also works in transportation, His very hard-working wife, despite difficulties, has been able to get ahead.

Julio continues working hard to improve his living conditions and those of his wife. For this, he continues working hard and putting in effort. He asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of supplies for the store, such as drinks, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and more, and in this way to continue offering their customers good quality. He is grateful for the opportunity that he gets to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and more.

loans.name: Wilma Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 43 años, es muy ahorrativa y responsable de estado civil casada, su esposo es agricultor, tiene una hija, Paola de 16 años que está estudiando en una institución de la localidad, a la que le ha enseñado ahorrar su dinero para invertir en negocios Eugenia hace 20 años atrás se dedica a la compra de ganado lechero. Ella necesita el dinero para poder comprar una vaca para ir aumentando así sus ganancias con el fin de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Eugenia is 43 years old, is very thrifty and responsible, she is married, her husband is a farmer, and she has a daughter, Paola, who is 16 and is studying at a local school. They have taught her to save her money to invest in business.  For 20 years, Eugenia has worked purchasing dairy cows. She needs the money to be able to purchase a cow to continue increasing her earnings with the end of helping her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, de 40 años de edad, es agricultor de profesión y muy trabajador, dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a la siembra de granos básicos, está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con su madre en su humilde casa.

José, se dedica a la agricultura y la crianza de cerdos y ambas actividades son fundamentales para la subsistencia de su familia.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como abonos y fertilizantes para la milpa, la cual necesita de este tipo de productos para dar un mejor cosecha; esto garantizará obtener una mejor cosecha.

José, desea seguir trabajando para que la tierra de dé frutos.
texts.en:
José, 40 years old, is farmer by trade and is very hard-working. He spends the majority of his time planting basic grains. He is single, does not have children, and lives with his mother in their humble house.

José works in agriculture and in raising pigs and both activities are fundamental for the subsistence of his family.

José needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure and fertilizer for the corn crop, which needs this type of products to give a better harvest. This will guarantee that he gets a better harvest.

José wants to continue working so that his land bears fruit.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure and fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 60 years old, married and has five children.

She is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Consolacion requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Consolacion has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Consolacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: ro purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 73 years old, and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, noodles, egg, spices, etc., to sell.

Francisca has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, noodles, egg, spices, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is 36 years old. She is married and has one children aged 8. Many years ago, she established her produce and vegetable sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy pesticides and seeds. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
Radha, 50 years old, is married and has two children. Many years ago, she established her grocery shop business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods. In the future, she plans to uplift her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is a married woman with four grown children. Her husband is a laborer and Lenita helps him by raising hogs. This gave her the chance to make the most of her time while also earning a living.

Just like other hog raisers, it is a common challenge to keep the supply of feed available. She is asking a loan to buy more piglets to raise as well as stocks of feed to fatten them. With a loan, she can be assured that her business will thrive and can anticipate a better return of her investment.
Lenita's loan will be for her family's food consumption and savings for old age.

loans.use: to  buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Ma. Amorlina

texts.en:
Ma. Amorlina is blessed with a Sari-sari store business to attend to. Not only is this a business but this allows her to her customers and neighbors in Merida, Leyte. She sell basic household grocery items like canned food, liquor, shampoo, bath soap, candies, biscuits and seasoning. 

Ma. Amorlina wish to increase her income with the help of a loan from CEVI. She will use it to buy soft drinks, liquor, eggs. These items are bought on a daily basis by the residents. With stocks in bulk, she can have a better income in the coming months. She lives in Merida, Leyte with her adult son and husband who is a Security Guard.

loans.use: to  buy soft drinks, liquor, eggs

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jonna is 37 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Jonna has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines. Jonna requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits like banana, sweet potato and etc.

Jonna has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like banana, sweet potato and etc

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a married woman, 59 years old with five children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Ligaya has a upholstery business in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials and maintenance for her business.

Ligaya has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and maintenance for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children, ages 25, 23 and 19. In 1999, Jayanti established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Barrio America Group

texts.es:
El grupo se encuentra dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. Carolina, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropas, es muy buena vendedora, y comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, es por ello que le está yendo muy bien. Carolina por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser jeans, camisas , pantalones, remeras, blusas, shorts y otro tipo de prendas, de manera a poder tener una Buena cantidad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is in the elimination of poverty program. Each one is putting forth their best effort in order to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones. Carolina is one of the members of this group. She sells all types of clothes. She is a good seller. She says that she has made very good customers. Therefore, it is going very well for her. Through her work Carolina has the means to be able to help her family and give them a better quality of life.

She is requesting this lona in order to be able to buy varied clothing to sell. She will buy things like jeans, shirts, pants, t-shirts, blouses, and shorts, etc. This way she will be able to have a good quantity of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy varied clothing like jeans, shirts, pants, t-shirts, blouses, and shorts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en: Maricar is a young woman of 22. After being in a relationship at an early age, she already have two children aged five and six. Her husband is a farmer. Maricar learns to find a way to help him by raising hogs. Maricar is asking a loan to continue her four-year-old business of raising hogs.  She will use it to buy piglets and feed. It is her hope that her business will flourish and impact the present condition of her family in a positive way. Any profit will be utilized for school fees and food for the family. She and her family lives in Merida, Leyte.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has received a number of loans from KIVA which has really helped her transportation business. The income derived from her tricycle has covered her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 15000 PHP loan for her to buy for new tires and other accessories of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help meet her family's daily needs.

Yolanda aims to sustain her transport service and hopefully acquire another tricycle. She prays that God will bless her livelihood. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and accessories of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

Rona dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
Melrose is 40 years old and has two children. Melrose is married and has two children are still in school.

Melrose is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melrose requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Melrose has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melrose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is widowed with one child and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina is 34 years old and has three children.  Florina is married and has three children are still in school.

Florina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Florina requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Florina has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is a married woman, 60 years old with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Bernadith has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Bernadith requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cloth, thread, needle and other materials for her business.

Bernadith has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, needle and other materials for her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 63 years old, married and has two children.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilyn has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 36 years old and has one child still in school.

Rowena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and maintenance for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Yolanda Nelly

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 40 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su sposo es chofer, tiene dos hijos, 
ella se dedica a la compra y venta de chanchos hace más de diez años, manifiesta que este negocio le ha permitido criar a sus hijos. Yolanda solicita el crédito para comprar más chanchos y así incrementara sus ganancias y seguirá cubriendo sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Yolanda, age 40, is married. Her husband is a driver, and she has two children. She has been buying and selling pigs for over ten years. She says that this business has allowed her to raise her children.

Yolanda is requesting a loan to buy more pigs. This way she will increase her earnings and continue covering her necessities.

loans.use: to get more piglets for her business.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children aged 19 and 16. In 2004, she established her handicraft business. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her handicrafts business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria's previous loan helped finance and sustain her direct selling business thus allowing to send her college-aged child to school and meet the family's daily living expenses.

Victoria is requesting another loan for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase personal products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

Victoria hopes to open a boutique to attract more clients and to see her child finish college to find better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Kuña Rory está en su ciclo número 18 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Es un grupo muy unido que viene trabajando de manera unida hace ya muchos ciclos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eva quien se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, a través del trabajo que ella hace en la venta de calzados y ropas. Ella está luchando y se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar calzados y prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y cumpliendo de esa manera con sus clientes y con los pedidos que tiene. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando en cada emprendimiento que hacen.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory group is in its 18th cycle in the women's committee program. They are all working and helping each other to get ahead. It is a very united group that has been working in a united way for many cycles. Eva is one of the members. She is improving her poverty situation through the work she does selling shoes and clothes. She is struggling, and she puts forth great effort in order to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She is a very hard-working and tenacious woman who wants to improve her living conditions. That is why she puts forth so much effort.

She is requesting to loan in order to be able to buy shoes and varied clothing. This way she will be able to continue with her sales and meeting her customers' needs and filling the orders that she has.

They are grateful for the opportunity they are getting to be able to continue growing and improving with each endeavor that they make.

loans.use: to buy shoes and varied clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is 24 years old. She is from Jagna, Bohol. In her house, Marife was able to make a room for a sari-sari store business. She sells liquor, chips, shampoo, toothpaste, powdered fruit juice, and biscuits. She would like to expand her business and make room for more merchandise. She plans to use her loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, coffee, milk, chips, and soap. Marife has hope for the future and she will continue to work hard so that her two children, aged five and eight, can go to school.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, coffee, milk, chips, and soap.

loans.name: Sonilda De Mercedes

texts.es: Sonilda es una mujer de 42 años, que se dedica a la elaboración de helados y actualmente habita en la ciudad de Matagalpa. Este es el segundo préstamo que Sonilda solicita, el primero lo utilizó para comprar los insumos para la elaboración de helados. Este nuevo crédito que solicita, lo necesita para ampliar su negocio mediante la apertura de una sucursal en la ciudad de León, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonilda is a 42-year-old woman who works making ice cream and currently lives in the city of Matagalpa.

This is Sonilda’s second loan. She used the first one to buy supplies for the production of ice cream.

She needs this new loan to expand her business by opening a branch in the city of Leon. This will allow her to increase her incomes and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her business by opening a branch in the city of Leon.

loans.name: Sandra Emperatriz

texts.es: Sandra tiene 30 años de edad, es muy trabajadora y responsable de estado civil casada, su esposo es agricultor, tiene tres hijos Luis de 11 años, Carlos de 7 años y Pricila de 5 años, que están estudiando en una institución de la localidad,  Sandra hace 10 años atrás se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos. Ella necesita el dinero para poder comprar mas pollos para ir aumentando así sus ganancias con el fin de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 30, is very hard-working and responsible. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. She has three children. Luis is 11; Carlos is seven; and Pricila is 5. They go to a school in the area.

Sandra has been buying and selling chickens for ten years. She needs the money in order to be able to buy more chickens. She will do this to increase her earnings in order to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to increase her business of raising and selling chickens.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a mother of five children; three adult and two-school-aged children. She and her family live in the town of Ajuy, in Iloilo, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman, while Eden is running a sari-sari store business to help her husband earn a living. 

Eden has been proficiently doing this business for more than 10 years. She is asking for a bigger amount of loans to help them enhance their livelihood by buying additional stocks for her sari-sari store business, such as biscuits, bread, chips, candies, chocolate bars, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, soft drinks, noodles, and canned goods. 

Eden dreams to be successful in the future. She wants to augment their livelihood to give good life to her family.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, bread, chips, candies, chocolate bars, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, soft drinks, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is from the town of Valencia in Bohol. She is 32 years old and married with two children ages 4 and 6. Last year, she started raising piglets to fatten and sell. She also cooks vegetables and snacks to augment her income. Flordeliza needs additional capital to buy feed, flour, and vegetables. The loan is her hope so she can continue her business without having to rely on neighbors. The loan will also allow her to stock more feed and not buy on a per-kilo basis, which is more expensive. Her only dream is to be able to afford to give her children the right education.

loans.use: to buy feed, flour, and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina has received a number of loans from Kiva, which have really sustained her small general store. The income derived from her store has covered her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy and refill her store with canned goods, rice, instant noodles, cooking oil, eggs, beverages, etc. Her profits from her business will definitely help meet her family's daily needs. She is thanking God for your untiring support for her livelihood.

Rosalina aims to grow her store and look for another location to open a branch. She prays that God will bless her livelihood. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Lota

texts.en:
Ma. Lota is 45 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Lota runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as spices, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Lota would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is 59 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Erlina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Erlina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Erlina has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Erlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 69 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nimfa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nimfa has been raising pigs  for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 45 years old and married with two children.  With one child in school, Nelia works very hard to provide for them.

Nelia has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as spices, personal care products, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future Nelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cheese making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her cheese making business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Gina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cheese making business.

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Melchorita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from cafeteria and selling used clothing.  Melchorita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Melchorita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 67 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like personal care products, canned good, soft-drinks and other groceries.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Pacencia dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more items like personal care products, canned good, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en:
Bebina is 57 years old, married with four children. 

Bebina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Bebina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bebina has been farming vegetables for twenty years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bebina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merciditha

texts.en:
Merciditha is 59 years old, married with seven children.

Merciditha works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Merciditha has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

Merciditha aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like fattening pigs.

Milagros dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 39 años muy emprendedora, que se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales desde hace 14 años, y que ahora quiere incursionar en el negocio de la venta de ropa.
Esta no es la primera vez que Rosa solicita un crédito, el anterior lo utilizó para comprar los ingredientes que necesitaba para la elaboración de los nacatamales, este nuevo préstamo lo requiere para comprar maíz, leña y telas, lo último lo necesita para elaborar, kimonas y fundas para vender.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 39, is very enterprising. She has been making 'nacatamales' [steamed corncakes that are similar to Mexican tamales, but nacatamales are larger, filled with meat and vegetables and steamed in banana leaves] for 14 years.

Now she wants to enter the business of selling clothes. This is not the first time that Rosa has requested a loan. She used the previous loan to buy the ingredients needed to make the nacatamales.

She needs this new loan to buy corn, firewood, and fabric. She needs the last itme to make kimonos and covers to sell.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and fabric.

loans.name: Horxai Group

texts.en: Phuveng’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Phuveng and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Phuveng and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Phuveng’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Parul And Group

texts.en:
37-year-old Parul leads a group of five women. The other members of the group are Himanti, Bhabani, Minati and Rita. All the members are from the Kamrup district of Assam. Parul is a mother of only one daughter and runs a shoe shop in her village. She wants a loan in order to expand her business so that she can earn more income and help her family. She expects her monthly income to increase by Rs. 900. She wants to purchase more stock of ladies shoes, gents shoes, chappals, etc. For that, she needs a loan. 

Parul and her group need a loan to expand their businesses and that will help them earn more income. They are very grateful to their lenders for the timely financial support and encouragement.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of shoes to expand her shoes selling business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like tricycle passenger.

Gina dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nasang Group

texts.en: Bounlerd understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Bounlerd knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Bounlerd purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Bounlerd is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection for his clothing shop before the winter season

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita is 38 years-old, married and has two children aged 11 and 9 years old. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Sita plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita has three children and is from Jagna, Bohol. She is dependent on her farm's output to live. She owns land for farming rice, vegetables, and spring onions. She would like to keep her business going but she needs additional capital.

Miguelita is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fertilizer, rice seedlings, and pesticides for her farm. She hopes to have a good harvest so she can pay her children's school fees and buy healthy food for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seedlings. and pesticides.

loans.name: Maria Gina

texts.en:
Maria Gina is a married woman  and has four children. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 3.
Her means of living is raising hogs.  In addition to that, she also engages in farming, and grows corn.

For the past quite long years, she has been engaged in hog raising , serving neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge which is the liquidity of capital to expand.

Maria Gina decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. She wants to buy piglets. In that way, she could improve the number of livestock she is about to raise. Slowly, it enables her to improve her earnings and start to expand her both project.

In the future, She is looking forward to continue finance her children studies and to continue manage her business well.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal, a 21 year old young man lives with his mother and younger brother in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon. He is currently single, which allows him to fully support his family in the absence of his father.

He is very ambitious, and in the process of graduating from university. Two years ago, in order to cover his university tuition and provide for his family, Bilal opened a shoes shop for men inside the camp. At first, he got the financial support from his two older brothers living outside Lebanon; but Bilal decided to rely on himself since then.

For the first time he is asking for 1,543,992 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa in order to buy the new winter collection. His all concern is to satisfy his clients' demand and provide them with products they need.
By getting this loan, Bilal will be able to attract more clients and sell more shoes, which will increase his income and profitability. Therefore, he will sustain his business and provide new job opportunities for the job seekers in the area.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of men's shoes for his store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old, married with three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, noodles, etc. to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 38 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Cecile works very hard to provide for them.

Cecile has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Cecile has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sardines, spices and other groceries. 

In the future Cecile would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tonneua Group

texts.en: Domphone is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Domphone and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Domphone and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Domphone and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Domphone and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, a twenty-four year old woman. She has  six-year old dependent and resides in the rural area of Pilar, Bohol.  Her source of income is through raising and selling of hogs. To meet the demands of her family, she also engages in farming. She grows rice. 
Her partner in life has an income that could help defray the family's expenses.

Helen is asking for a loan to buy pig feeds and fertilizer. She could start  to  improve the yield of her farm and raise quality hogs  too. In that way, her livelihood  will become productive. 

In the future, Helen  is hoping that she could expand her hog raising livelihood to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara is 48 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 26. Many years ago,She established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gulu

texts.en: Gulu is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy a water pump. His business goal is to be the main water supplier in the area within 5 years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie did not allow the small space for her piggery to prevent her from establishing a business. While some people use concrete barns, Rosalie makes do with her wooden barn to house piglets to fatten. Rosalie also sells Avon products like lotion, perfume, lingerie, and cosmetics.

She needs a loan to buy feed to keep her hogs healthy and free from disease. Any income will be utlized for the education of her four school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 44 years old and has six children. Judith is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Judith is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Judith has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 54 years old and married with six children. 

Juliet is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Juliet has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Juliet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Turaki village. As a Babban Gona member, Adamu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Adamu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Adamu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Adamu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a hardworking married man living in Ntungamo, Uganda, where he grows crops as his main source of income. He has been a farmer for over eight years.income. He has been a farmer for over eight years.
He is married and has two children.  

He has a dream of buying more land and increasing his household income, although he also has other household tasks to look after his family.

Deus faces a challenge of bad seasons that affect the growth and output of his crops.

He needs a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his land

loans.name: Lilia Isabel

texts.es: Lilia es una comerciante reconocida en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, desde joven su anhelo fue tener su propio negocio y después de laborar por muchos años, logró ahorrar el capital para su proyecto.  Lilia cuenta con una amplia experiencia en la administración de su minitienda ubicada en esta localidad, y durante sus 17 años de trayectoria empresarial ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida y autosustentar sus necesidades puesto que es viuda. Ella es madre de seis hijos a quienes ofreció bienestar con el fruto de su trabajo y diariamente pasa largas jornadas en su negocio para lograr obtener las ventas esperadas y así llegar al punto de equilibrio para luego garantizar utilidades. No es una tarea fácil por lo fluctuante que pueden ser las ventas a raíz de diversos factores, sin embargo, Lilia es constante y está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir surtido; gaseosas, mecatos y dulces, con la finalidad de que sus clientes encuentren todo en un mismo lugar.  Su meta a futuro es convertir su tienda en un autoservicio y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lilia is a well-known trader in a neighbourhood of the town of Soledad. She wanted to have her own business from a young age and, after working for many years, was able to save the capital needed for this project. Lilia is very experienced in running her small shop here and working in her business for 17 years has enabled her to improve her quality of life and support herself independently, as she is a widow. 

She is the mother of six children, who have benefited from the fruits of her labour, and she spends long hours at her business every day in order to meet her sales expectations, break even and then ensure a profit. This is not an easy task as her sales can vary depending on several factors, but Lilia perseveres and is using her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in supplies: fizzy drinks, pastries and sweets, so that her customers can find everything in one place.

Her future goals are to turn her shop into a self-service restaurant and to remodel her home.

loans.use: to invest in supplies: fizzy drinks, pastries and sweets

loans.name: Napha Group

texts.en: Seephone understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Seephone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Seephone purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Seephone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Las Valiosas Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “LAS VALIOSAS” conformada por 05 socias trabajadoras. Este es el caso de esperanza de 27 años de edad casada con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo Desde hace 3 meses que tiene dicho negocio gracias a su esfuerzo está mejorando su calidad de vida. Su mayor deseo es de poder su local propio ya que lo hace de forma ambulatoria. Solicito el crédito para la compra de más ropa como pantalones y polos y faldas. El grupo “las valiosas” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite mejorar su calidad de vida. Esperanza  es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste beige.
texts.en:
This is the new group, "LAS VALIOSAS", which has five working members. 

Esperanza, aged 27, is married and has two dependent children. She sells clothing by mail-order. She has had this business for three months and, thanks to her efforts, her quality of life is improving. Her greatest wish is to be able to have her own premises, as she currently goes door to door. She is requesting the loan in order to buy more clothes, such as trousers, polo shirts and skirts.

The group "Las Valiosas" is grateful to the people who made this loan possible through Kiva, as it is letting them improve their quality of life. Esperanza is the third person from the left, dressed in beige.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, such as trousers, polo shirts and skirts

loans.name: Tarmi

texts.en:
Tarmi, 60 years old, is married and has two children. Many years ago, she established her construction business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy timber wood. In the future, she plans to uplift her family's economic conditions. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small construction store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Timber woods are purchased daily for construction of buildings, roads and other construction work. Owners of small stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: G.s  Dar Para Vivir 2 Group

texts.en:
Jessica is the coordinator of her group, GS. Dar para Vivir (Give to Live) 2. This solidarity group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry, where these businesswomen run their activities in their community and others nearby. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her two children and her long term partner.

Jessica is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She is running a Beauty Salon and she is planning to use this loan to invest in her business by hair and beauty products, especially products line to wash and conditioner hair that her clients can buy directly in her salon, some women's accessories and other products. The other members run different businesses like a butcher shop, and miscellaneous products sales.

Jessica will use her profits to improve her home and invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair product lines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, seasoning, soy sauce, cooking oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
For 10 years now, Leonida has been into operating a sari-sari (variety) store business and also raising hogs. This business brings in PHP 5,000 of average profit per month for her family. She is supporting a daughter who is 18 years old.

She would like to expand her business and buy more piglets, feed, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee and biscuits.

Leonida has high hopes for the future of her investments. Her income will pay for her household expenses, allow her to save and reinvest in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee and biscuits, as well as piglets and feed.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is thankful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) has partnered with Kiva to help entrepreneurs lacking capital to run a business. She’s grateful that CCT granted her previous loan amount of Php13,000 and also want to thank lenders for participating in the kiva program. The amount was used to buy additional grocery products for the business.  There’s an increase on her daily sales. However the daily profit is just enough to pay for their day-to-day expenditures. 

Dedication and perseverance are the qualities that she has that’s why the business is still growing. She dreams of investing for their own house and lot someday and to have array of products to offer. That’s why she decided to apply for another loan of Php15,000 as she wants to have added capital to buy products on stock such as bottled drinks and grocery items to add on her variety store business.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Josephine spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store such as grocery items and bottled drinks.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Wnfred is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, cocoa, salt and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 25 years old and has two children. Cecile is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Cecile is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Cecile requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cecile has been raising livestock for 1 year now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cecile would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis from Vanadzor city of the Lori region sends his great regards and thanks to all the Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon as well for his first Kiva loan and he is so hopeful that he will be supported for the second time. As previously he is still engaged in shoe making small business that he manages in his own small workshop. Sargis lives with his wife and his granddaughter, since his son and his wife are aboard and from there they send money for their needs.

Sargis’ granddaughter is still student of Yerevan State University at the faculty of International Relations and she studies at the paid division. This time again Sargis asks this loan of 480.000 Armenian drams, in order to pay his granddaughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay his granddaughter’s university tuition fee for the first semester, in International Relations

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmen is 39 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Carmen has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmen has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: Victor tiene 21 años, es un joven muy dedicado y responsable con su trabajo, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres, el se dedica hace 5 años a la crianza y venta de chanchos, Victor necesita el dinero para poder comprar mas crias e ir aumentando así sus ganancias con el fin de ayudar en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Victor is 21 years old. He's a young man who's very dedicated and responsible with his work. He's single and lives with his parents. For five years, he has been raising and selling pigs.

Victor needs the money to be able to buy more piglets and continue increasing his income with the goal of helping with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy and sell pigs.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiruis amaize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Kabiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Kabiru can store hismaize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru will benefit from marketing support that could see himgenerate earnings of up to $2000/ha.Kabiruis thankful that henow has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and familyand looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Elym Beatriz

texts.es: Elym es una mujer de 32 años de edad que se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, además buscando obtener mejores ingresos económicos se dedica a la venta de lociones, mejorando de esta forma su economía. Elym vive en vivienda humilde pero propia desde hace varios años, en la que habita junto a su hija a la que brinda todo lo que está en sus manos. Elym desea mejorar las paredes de su vivienda que están construidas de láminas deterioradas, anteriormente solicito un crédito con el cual instalo energía eléctrica y construyo una parte del muro de retención, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, lámina y polines para cambiar las láminas de las paredes y terminar el muro de retención de su vivienda y de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Elym is a 32-year-old woman who earns a living raising and selling chicken. Also, in search of a better income, she works selling lotions to improve her savings. Elym lives in a humble home she's owned for several years, together with her daughter, whom she gives everything that's in her hands.

Elym wants to improve the walls in her house, which are made with deteriorated sheets. Earlier, she got a loan and used it to put in electricity and part of a retaining wall. That's why she's seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, sheet and poles to change the sheets on the walls and finish the retaining wall of her home, thus improving the quality of life in her home.

loans.use: to invest in brick, concrete, sheet and boards to change the sheets on the walls and finish the retaining wall.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a widow with 8 children. She operates a farm where she grows maize and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her plant potatoes. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable her to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Alemania Democratica Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Alemania Democrática está conformado por tres mujeres laboriosas, quienes solicitan por tercer vez el financiamiento en ADIM, el grupo es coordinado por Sobeyda una mujer luchadora de 22 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de 5 y 1 año quienes son su mayor motivación, ella se dedica a la venta de bisutería desde hace tres años con la ayuda  de su mama, mediante la fabricación de pulseras y collares, una de sus metas es desarrollar el negocio por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de perlas, elástico, aretes, collares y bolsos  uno de sus logros con el crédito anterior fue aumentar sus ventas y reinvertir. La segunda socia es Elisa de 31 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace tres años y la tercer socia es Karla de 47 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, jugo y repostería.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Alemania Democrática is made up of three hardworking women who are seeking ADIM financing for the third time. The group is led by Sobeyda, a striving 22-year-old woman who's married and the mother of two children, five and one year old, who are her best motivation.

For three years, she's earned a living in jewelry with the help of her mother by making bracelets and necklaces. One of her goals is to develop the business. For this, she's seeking a loan to purchase beads, elastic, earrings, necklaces and bags.

One of her achievements with the earlier loan was to increase her sales and reinvest. The second member, Elisa, 31, has earned a living selling used clothes for three years. The third member, Karla, 47, sells sodas, juice and cake.

loans.use: to purchase beads, elastic, earrings, necklaces and bags.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy used the previous loan of Php 15,000 for buying raw ingredients needed in making buko salad. He never thought that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) willvquickly respond to his loan application. Genuine appreciation he wants to send to all of the people used by God for the approval and assistances on his previous loan.

Jimmy is now able to earn an approximate amount of Php 12,000 every month. He aims for the business to continue to operate and have more earnings each day, for him to save money for future purposes. Since the business helped him a lot to sustain their daily needs, he’s contemplating of ways on how to increase revenue.  He aspires to have enough revolving fund for buying necessities for his food business like fresh coconuts, kilos of sugar and dairy products like condensed and evaporated milk; that’s why he applied for a loan amount of Php 25,000. If ever granted, it will be an advantage for the business success to take place.

Jimmy has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where he hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks and supplies of raw ingredients for his buko salad business.

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak is 67 years old and he lives with his wife in Kapan city of Syunik region. He has higher pedagogical education and now he works of his specialty at the city’s college. Spartak has three daughters; two of them are already married and they live with their families and their smallest daughter is in Russian Federation now and works there.

Spartak has very nice vineyard with the perfect harvest and having all the best sorts of grapes (kishmish, muskat and areni), which are used in wine making. He manages to have good profit of its sales. He sells all his grape harvest to the factories that produce wine and profitably sells it. As he says he likes his nice vineyard and manages all the work in it with great pleasure.

Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he asks as he must buy a new water tank, also new watering pipes, some seedlings and young grape trees so that doing all these works now he will surely have good harvest next year.

loans.use: to buy a new water tank, also new watering pipes, some seedlings and young grape vines so that doing all these works now he will surely have good harvest next year.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Helen has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer.  Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Ibrahim can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ibrahim has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Ibrahim is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university  education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nakham Group

texts.en: Von is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Von and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Von and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Von and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Von and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Tươi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tươi is 56 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has been working in agriculture raising chickens for 9 years.Tươi lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Tươi faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.
In 2013, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Tươi has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of a three-member group.

In the future, Tươi hopes to remodel her house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a spare tire, motor oil and pay for vulcanizing.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr:
Daniel à 28 ans s’est marié, il y 3 mois, le nouveau couple est encore sans enfant. Sa femme l’appui dans l’activité de vente de fruits. Le couple vit dans une maison louée. 
Il vend des fruits sur le marché. Actuellement, c’est la saison des mangues. Cette activité constitue sa principale source de revenus. Pour l’approvisionnement, il va jusqu’au lieu de production pour avoir des fruits de bonne qualité. L’activité nécessite un fonds de roulement important pour disposer des produits de qualité et en quantité suffisante. Il a déjà demandé deux prêts pour s’approvisionner.Le prêt servira  à acheter des mangues destinées à la vente. Les fruits vendus varient selon la saison.
L’objectif est l’extension de l’activité. Le rêve étant de pouvoir construire une maison afin d’éviter le paiement d’un loyer.
texts.en:
Daniel, age 28, was married three months ago. The newlyweds have no children. They live in a rented house. Daniel's wife supports him in his fruit sales activity. Currently, it is mango season.

This is Daniel's main source of income. He buys his stock directly at the growers' production sites to get high-quality merchandise. This activity requires substantial working capital to store a sufficient quantity of quality products. Daniel has previously obtained two loans to acquire stock. This new loan will help him to buy mangoes to sell. The fruit selection depends on the season.

Daniel's goal is to expand his activity. He wants to build a house and stop having to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy mangoes.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona is 39 years old, married and lives at Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 15,000PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of feeds

location.town: Sindangan - Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Vision Gruop Group

texts.en:
The township of chorkor in the greater region of Ghana, are five hard working traders in the Vision Group.
A single parented trader Grace who sell octopus at the market place desired to buy more octopus and dried fish to sell. Due to the high demand of octopus from her buyers, she seek the help of Kiva through ID-Ghana to buy enough octopus to meet their demand.

Grace will be very grateful if her need are met due to her loyal and committed attitude of repayment of loan.

loans.use: to buy enough octopus and dried fish to meet the demand of her buyers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a man on his early 40's, he shares his life with a loving wife and his beloved daughter. He is a very hard working person and in order to make a living and move his family ahead he works 7 days per week. Monday to Friday he drives a motorbike taxi and at the weekend he sells sport shoes on a street stand. He has been working on his street stand for 20 years, so he know the business perfectly and wants to expand it by investing in it.

In order to match the investment needed Daniel is looking for a 10,527.00 MXN loan. With this he will be able to buy a vast majority of shoes that he will offer for the clients demand.
Daniel's biggest achievement is managing to have a nice family and a business of his own. His long term goals are to be prosperous and a job provider for other people.

loans.use: to invest in more stock for his shoe selling stand.

loans.name: G.s Ebenezer 1 Group

texts.en: Estanisla is the coordinator of her group, GS. Ebenezer 1. This solidarity group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, Dominion Republic, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry. Estanisla makes her home in a simple structure with one of her three children. Her other two children have left home, but they visit often. Estanisla is excited to take her eighth loan from Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to improve her delicateses business (a food stall that sells fried food especially for events and activities) by purchasing ingredients like chicken, beef, and flour. She also sells other snacks that she makes. Estanisla says she enjoys this business, specially cooking. Her most important dream is to have a successful business to produce enough income to have a tranquil life along with her family. She will continuing saving and re-investing her business profits. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy food supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is from the community of Alegria in the province of Cebu. She is 35 years old with multiple livelihoods (three) to sustain the needs of her family. She runs a sari-sari store business, farms rice and raise piglets for sale.

With these businesses and two kids aged 4 and 10, Ritchel needs additional funds to buy feed, fertilizer, salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste and milk.

Ritchel is looking forward to having a prosperous life with these businesses.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer, salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste and milk.

loans.name: Bhanu

texts.en:
Bhanu is 38 years-old. She is married and has two children, aged 18 and 15. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margans. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is married to a tricycle driver from Merida, Leyte. She is aware of the need for fuel for their tricycle business. Out of this necessity, she started selling gasoline near the highway of their place. The fuel is placed in an empty soft drinks bottle for accurate measurement. She is asking a loan to buy more gasoline to sell to increase her revenue. It is her dream to continue increasing the volume of her fuel so as to increase her profits for her household expenses like food and electricity bill.
