loans.use: to buy more gasoline

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey has been considerably saving for house improvement. He has efficiently manage his farming activities particularly corn and has brought enough for the needs of his family. Recently, he is renovating his kitchen area and has seek additional financing.

He applied a loan from PMPC to buy cement and tiles for flooring. Junrey wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy cement and tiles for flooring

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Rosalie has supported her husband doing this type of work especially in marketing their produce. She is the person in charge in bookings to rice retailers driving their own multi cab.  Like a farmer, Rosalie has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, she applied a loan to purchase spare parts and to pay for shop repairs.  Someday, Rosalie hopes to purchase a hauling truck for delivery.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and to pay for shop repairs

loans.name: Auwal

texts.en: Auwal is a Babban Gona farmer.  Auwal is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Auwal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Auwal can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Auwal has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Auwal is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having money to increase his farm land and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare tires, sprockets, motor oil and pay for maintenance repair.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en: Kabiru is a maize farmer from Baka village. As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Kabiru will use this loan to store the maize he harvests,enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Kabiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Kabiru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer from Kurungofi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Dahiru is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dahiru can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Dahiru is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Unidos Group

texts.es:
Unidos es el nombre que lleva un grupo originario de Veracruz; en una zona productora de caña de azúcar donde su ingenio está considerado dentro de los primeros 5 con mayor producción de azúcar refinada a nivel nacional. La temporada más especial para los habitantes es llamada zafra o de recolección.  El nombre del grupo fue decidido después que todos los integrantes coincidieron en que solo la unidad los podrá hacer más fuertes. 
   Ellos son: Camerina y Viviana quienes invertirán en cosméticos; Rubén, en un club  nutricional; Amado, en frituras; Juan, en una imprenta; Consuelo, en cosméticos y tejidos; Reyna, Sandra, Herminia y Silvana, en ropa; Olivia, en una carnicería y María, en un negocio de comida.
   Juan Manuel es un joven muy trabajador quien para solventar los gastos de su familia se ha desempeñado como DJ desde hace más de 10 años, “me apasiona la música, realizar mezclas y lo mejor de todo es que me pagan por hacerlo” expresó contento. Sin embargo para complementar sus ingresos decidió abrir una imprenta de lunes a viernes con la que tiene tres años de experiencia. Aprendió dicho oficio ya que trabajó con un tío el cual lo apoyo para independizarse comprando máquinas y herramientas necesarias. El éxito de su negocio se lo atribuye a la buena atención al cliente, la calidad, la diversidad de modelos y, desde luego, los precios accesibles; “si el cliente llega con una idea yo la hago realidad, por eso siempre regresan” expresó. De esta manera ha logrado coordinar ambas actividades para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus seres queridos.
   El préstamo lo ha solicitado para invertir en la compra de tinta, hojas y pegamento debido a que es el material que más utiliza en la imprenta. “Me alegra que nos hayan otorgado una nueva oportunidad con el préstamo, espero que alguno de mis hijos se interese en esta actividad para hacerla crecer” expresa con emoción.
*La fotografía fue tomada en un antiguo pozo, Juan es quien viste playera negra y gorra.
texts.en:
"United" is the name given to this group from Veracruz, in a region that produces cane sugar. Their production is considered among the five highest refined sugar producers in the country. The most special time for the residents is called "zafra," or harvest. The name of the group was decided after the members agreed that only unity can make them stronger.

They are Camerina and Viviana, who will invest in cosmetics; Rubén, in a nutricional club; Amado, in fried food; Juan, in printing; Consuelo, in cosmetics and woven goods; Reyna, Sandra, Herminia and Silvana, in clothing; Olivia, in a butcher shop y María, in a food business.

Juan Manuel is a very hardworking young man. To pay for his family's expenses, he's worked at a DJ for more than 10 years. "I'm passionate about music and making mixes, and the best thing is they pay me to do it," he said happily.

Still, to complement his income he decided to open a print shop from Monday to Friday and now has three years of experience. He learned this work from an uncle who supported him becoming independent and buying the necessary machines and tools. He attributes the success of his business to good customer service, the quality and diversity of models and, since then, affordable prices. "If the customer comes with an idea and I make it reality, they always come back," he said. In this way, he's succeeded in coordinating both jobs to bring his loved ones a better quality of life.

He's asked for the loan to invest in buying ink, sheets and glue because these are the materials he uses most in printing. "I'm happy we've been given a new opportunity with the loan and I hope some of my children are interested in this work to make it grow," he said with feeling.

(The photo was taken at an old well. Juan is the one wearing a black T-shirt and cap.)

loans.use: to buy ink, sheets and glue.

loans.name: Somsaard Group

texts.en: Van’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Van and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Van and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Van’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.
